911764.title: Authorship in the Balance: The Clash Between Human Authorship, Artificial Intelligence, and Copyright Law [Separately Ticketed]
911764.description:
Dive into the revolutionary impact of generative AI on comics in this two-hour CLE session. We'll explore the latest Copyright Office rulings and case law that are reshaping the boundaries of protection for AI-generated content and challenging the extent of copyright’s monopolistic safeguards. We'll also discuss emerging transactional practices, including drafting agreements that address the complexities of AI-created works. From intellectual property ownership challenges to licensing strategies, this session equips you with the tools needed to navigate the future of AI in the comic book industry. This session is approved for 2.5 CLE credits in professional practice for New York (both transitional and non-transitional).
Click here for more information: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/industry/professionals/cle-opportunities.html

911127.title: Hasbro Star Wars™ and Marvel Panel
911127.description: Hasbro hosts an action-packed toy panel with brand team members to reveal exciting new products, giving fans a first look across these iconic product lines. The panel will bring updates on the Hasbro lines inspired by Star Wars, including The Black Series and The Vintage Collection, and the Marvel Legends product line.

904757.title: JUJUTSU KAISEN Panel with English Voice Cast
904757.description: Celebrate the latest JUJUTSU KAISEN news with the English voice cast Adam McArthur (Yuji Itadori), Robbie Daymond (Megumi Fushiguro), Anne Yatco (Nobara Kugisaki), Kaiji Tang (Satoru Gojo), and Kayleigh McKee (Yuta Okkotsu) as they share behind-the-scenes stories and what fans can look forward to next.

909635.title: Critical Role & Prime Video: A Decade of Adventure and The Animated World of Exandria
909635.description: As the countdown begins for the November 19 premiere of The Mighty Nein on Prime Video, join Critical Role’s cast and executive producers—Laura Bailey, Matthew Mercer, Marisha Ray, Liam O’Brien, Ashley Johnson, Taliesin Jaffe, Sam Riegel, and Travis Willingham—for a can’t-miss conversation about what’s next in their expanding universe. Get the inside scoop on the upcoming animated series, fresh updates on The Legend of Vox Machina Season Four, and a special look ahead at Campaign Four of Critical Role's flagship show. Plus, celebrate 10 incredible years of storytelling with the cast.

902468.title: Creepy, Crafty & Curriculum-Ready: Spooky Stories for Classrooms, Libraries & Beyond!
902468.description: Spooky stories have long been a favorite among teen readers—and they offer so much more than just scares. This panel brings together librarians, educators, publishers, and creators to spotlight graphic novels, manga, and YA fiction that taps into spooky stories that resonate with teens. We will discuss how these titles can support literacy, spark critical thinking, and open conversations around culture, identity, and fear. Whether you are looking to diversify your teen collection, plan engaging library programs, or incorporate these stories into a curriculum, you will leave with practical ideas, thoughtful recommendations, and resources you can use right away.

909425.title: Star Wars: The Clone Wars Era Meetup @ NYCC!
909425.description:
Calling all troopers, Jedi, and citizens of the Republic!
Join us for an epic celebration of the Clone Wars era at *New York Comic Con*. This is the ultimate gathering for fans who bring to life the unforgettable characters of this iconic time in the Star Wars galaxy. from Clone Troopers and Jedi Generals to Mandalorians, Separatists, and beyond.

Whether you're sporting Phase I or Phase II armor, wielding a lightsaber in Jedi robes, or rocking your best Ahsoka or Ventress cosplay, this is your moment to shine! We'll be gathering for group photos, character meetups, and lots of Star Wars camaraderie.

Photographers welcome! This is a fantastic opportunity to capture incredible Clone Wars costumes in one place. We'll have dedicated time for group shots, character pairings, and solo portraits.

All ages and experience levels welcome. Whether you're a 501st veteran or new to cosplay, we want you there!

Come show your love for Star Wars: The Clone Wars, connect with fellow fans, and help us create an unforgettable moment in the galaxy far, far away.

May the Force be with you — and your camera charged!

909713.title: Cookie Run: Learn to Play Experience at NYCC
909713.description:
Step into the whimsical world of Cookie Run at New York Comic Con! Whether you’re a seasoned gamer or brand new to the franchise, our Learn to Play activation is the perfect way to jump in. Guided by our friendly demo team, you’ll explore the vibrant Cookie Run Kingdom, master the core rules, and experience the excitement of gameplay firsthand.

Come for the fun, stay for the cookie. No prior experience required - let’s play!

909489.title: Science Fiction Tropes: Best to Worst
909489.description: Some ideas posited in science fiction become reality (Lt. Uhuru's in-ear communicator), some may never happen (faster than light travel), and some are just kind of silly (single biome planets). With help from the audience, these acclaimed writers will discuss the best and worst science fiction inventions and tropes.
909489.people_list: C.J. Farley, John Scalzi, Emery Robin, Yume Kitasei

909813.title: Totally Metal!  Create Your Own Chainmail [Separately Ticketed]
909813.description: Think the idea of knitting with metal rings sounds, well, metal?  Get your pliers ready as Cowbutt Crunchies walks through the basic materials and process for creating chainmail fabric: the building block for all chainmail garments.  Students will practice creating their own sample chainmail pieces, which they will be able to bring home and complete. **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

902461.title: Cafecito at Comic Con
902461.description: Join us for an engaging panel on national superheroes from different countries, exploring how comic books created by colonial subjects serve as powerful tools for representation and world meaning making. Featuring Edgardo Miranda-Rodriguez, creator of La Borinqueña, alongside [names of one or two other comic book creators to be included ], and moderated by Aníbal Arocho, The Center for Puerto Rican Studies at Hunter College's Library Manager, this conversation will examine themes of NYPL and CENTRO collections, Afro and Indigenous identities, environmental justice, colonization, social activism, and cultural resilience. Through the lens of comics, panelists will discuss how these narratives challenge dominant histories, inspire new forms of storytelling, and empower communities to reimagine their place in the world.
902461.people_list: Anibal Arocho, Edgardo Miranda, Nicole Virella, David Betancourt

896882.title: Celebrating Five Years of The Department of Truth
896882.description: Now, more than ever, The Department of Truth reads less like fiction and more like a conspiracy uncovered. Join James Tynion and Martin Simmonds as they chat about the first five years of the series, and what the next five will look like. Moderated by Steve Foxe.

904352.title: 3rd Annual Broadway To Hollywood: A Look at the New Age of Musicals
904352.description:
Featuring panelists from Kiss of the Spider Woman, Miley Cyrus:
Something Beautiful, Joker: Folie à Deux, Barbie The Movie In Concert, and
more!

Step into the spotlight with the creative powerhouses behind hit musical productions as they
reveal how to take ideas to the stage or screen! From writing show-stopping musical moments
to editing scenes together and more, this is your exclusive insight into the behind-the-scenes
brilliance that brings musicals to life!

With Brian A. Kates (Editor of Kiss of the Spider Woman), David Meyer (Production Designer of
Miley Cyrus: Something Beautiful and Art Director of Joker: Folie à Deux), Macy Schmidt
(Orchestrator and Founder of The Sinfonietta, Barbie The Movie In Concert), and more to be
announced. Moderated by Katharine Quinn (Founder and CEO of And That's Showbiz). Part 1
of Impact24 PR’s Panel Superblock Series. Follow us on Instagram: @impact24pr

909683.title: Comic Con in Your School
909683.description: Want to make your own Comic Con for your school community? Join a panel of educators and administrators who have successfully implemented school-wide Comic Cons. Learn practical strategies for incorporating comics into your curriculum, build excitement around student creations, and transform your school into a dynamic hub for creativity and collaboration. Discover how to leverage Comic Cons as powerful learning experiences that celebrate student achievement and foster a love of storytelling.

911146.title: Jedi Meditation
911146.description: Calling all Younglings! Learn tips and techniques used by the Jedi Masters themselves, or take a few moments of calm in your busy day at NYCC. Hosted by Saber Guild’s Empire Temple.

909632.title: HBO / HBO Max presents A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms – Journey into Westeros with Dunk and Egg
909632.description: Step back into Westeros, a century before Game of Thrones, with unlikely duo, Ser Duncan the Tall, and his diminutive squire, Egg. Co-creator and executive producer George R.R. Martin, co-creator/showrunner Ira Parker, and stars Peter Claffey (Ser Duncan “Dunk” the Tall) and Dexter Sol Ansell (Egg) introduce the new HBO series A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms.
909632.people_list: Dexter Sol Ansell, George R.R. Martin, Ira Parker, Peter Claffey

896556.title: Age Positivity in Cosplay - @over30Cosplay for 30yrs-100+
896556.description:
Connect with Over30Cosplay and Over40Cosplay and panelists as they navigate through age positivity to discuss age related cosplay tips, creating age adaptive costume designs, developing personal relationships with other cosplayers, tips on how to connect with multi-generational groups, and positive ways to stay uplifted and energized through cosplaying from 30 yrs old to 100+!

This inspiring panel highlights the positive impact cosplay has on mental well-being, social connections, lifelong creativity and costuming without age limits. 

It will not only be fun and informative, but wonderful way to meet and greet and network with fellow cosplayers in our @over30cosplay panel!

909404.title: Demon Slayer Meetup
909404.description:
Demon Slayer Cosplay Meetup!
Step out of the shadows and into the spotlight! Join fellow slayers and demons for an unforgettable day of epic cosplay, killer photo ops, and fandom fun. Whether you wield a Nichirin blade or command blood demon arts, this is your moment to shine!

910548.title: Science Fiction Tropes - Post Panel Book Signing
910548.description: Join authors from the Science Fiction Tropes: Best to Worst panel as the greet fans and sign books. Books for all authors available for purchase from the Barnes & Nobel booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the signing area.
910548.people_list: C.J. Farley, Yume Kitasei, Emery Robin, John Scalzi

904202.title: Drawfee Live!
904202.description: Welcome to Drawfee, where we take your dumb ideas and make even dumber drawings! It's the hit youtube channel Drawfee, but live!

909685.title: LGBTQ-Inclusive Books, Comics and Popular Media for Young People
909685.description: Comics, animation, and books are universal mediums that have continuously grown in their support of LGBTQ-inclusive stories and characters for young audiences. These groundbreaking successes have created new opportunities for LGBTQ storytellers. Join us for a mix of animation and publishing storytellers as they discuss their projects, and we ask them: How did they approach LGBTQ content and characters for tweens and teens and young readers? How do new LGBTQ creators find their voice and get their start? What is the best advice they’ve received along their journey? How to stay hopeful in a challenging landscape? What are the new and upcoming projects to watch for?  Join moderator Cort Lane (Ultimate Spider-Man, GLAAD Kids & Family Advisory Council) and talented panelists Phil Jimenez (Wonder Woman: Historia, DC Comics Pride 2024), Brandon T. Snider (Dark Knight Manual, Rube Goldberg And His Amazing Machines), Shannon Watters (Lumberjanes, Hollow), Allen Wells (It’s Pride, Baby!, Danté Plays His Blues), and Vicki Johnson (Molly’s Tuxedo, Mac Wears a Hat).

911765.title: Comic Book Law 101: Foundations of Comic Book Law for a Changing Market [Separately Ticketed]
911765.description:
This CLE program combines a solid introduction to the legal fundamentals of the comic book industry with an incisive analysis of the distribution upheavals defining 2025. Topics include copyright basics, licensing agreements, and the seismic shifts in the market—from the decline of major digital platforms to the rise of indie distribution models and the persistence of physical retail. Attendees will walk away with practical insights to help clients thrive amidst these challenges. 
This session is approved for 2.5 CLE credits in professional practice for New York (both transitional and non-transitional).
Click here for more information: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/industry/professionals/cle-opportunities.html

909493.title: Judge This Book By Its Cover
909493.description: Authors Rob Hart (Detour), Jayson Green (Unworld), and Jennifer Keishin Armstrong (Parks and Rec: The Underdog TV Show that Lit'rally Inspired a Vision for a Better America), discuss what goes into the process of making the perfect package for a book and how their stunning covers came into being.
909493.people_list: Jennifer Keishin Armstrong, Jayson Green, Rob Hart

903897.title: The Road to The Dragon King
903897.description: Join the cast and crew as they give updates on The Dragon King, the next arc of The Dragon Prince saga! Hear the latest news about the Kickstarter and receive a special thanks for being an essential part of building this together — and we'll share some unique experiences of some of our backers! The panel includes creators Aaron Ehasz and Justin Richmond as well as surprise guests to shock and amaze you with news and insights. Don't miss it!
903897.people_list: Justin Richmond, Aaron Ehasz, Boone Williams

909803.title: Making a Cosplay Prop with Masked Dad Workshop [Reservation Required]
909803.description: Learn to build a cosplay prop with Masked Dad Workshop, a cosplay supply company founded by two dads of color in NYC. This hands-on workshop will teach you essential tips and tricks to get started, and give you the chance to ask questions in person with experienced, award-winning cosplayers. **A reservation Is required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

909567.title: DC Black Label, and Beyond!
909567.description: Step into a space where convention is reimagined and stories stretch beyond the edge of reality. This year, DC hosts a can’t-miss NYCC panel exploring new frontiers in adult graphic fiction, challenging genre norms, and amplifying unique voices across horror, fantasy, and speculative drama. From surreal explorations of identity and memory to unsettling dystopian visions, DC has always been the home for comics that refuse to fit the mold. Moderated by DC Executive Editor Chris Conroy.

911145.title: Star Wars Storytime
911145.description: Led by an award-winning New York State licensed librarian with over fifteen years of youth services experiences. Star Wars-themed books, music, crafts, and special appearances by some friends from a galaxy far, far away. LFL-recognized Star Wars charity costuming clubs will be in Family HQ in Hall 1E all four days, raising money for Make-A-Wish.

911147.title: Star Wars Meetup
911147.description:
Whether you’re on the light side or the dark side, all Star Wars cosplayers and fans are welcome to this meetup hosted by Rebel Legion’s Echo Base.

Star Wars Meetup (Thursday):  
https://www.facebook.com/share/19dsoJzRm4/?mibextid=wwXIfr
911147.people_list: Lisa Giunta-Popeil,  Rebel Legion - Echo Base

909160.title: How The Toys That Made Us Launched a Toy Company
909160.description: Brian Volk-Weiss (The Movies That Made Us, Disney’s Behind the Attraction) and the Nacelle team share how The Toys That Made Us docuseries launched Nacelle Toys, who now produce action figures for Star Trek toys, Biker Mice from Mars, RoboForce, The Expanse, C.O.W.-Boys of Moo Mesa, Sectaurs and more. Fans will get a sneak peek of the upcoming Polly Pocket episode from the new episodes of The Toys That Made Us.

909741.title: Panel Coming Soon
909741.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

901300.title: Incorporate Diversity and Accessibility Into Costumes & Content Creating
901300.description: At its core, this panel is about breaking barriers through fandom. As autistic and disabled creators, we’ve experienced firsthand how cosplay and content creation aren’t just hobbies—they’re lifelines. This panel will shine a spotlight on the ways that dressing up as your favorite hero, sharing your voice online, and connecting with a community can build confidence, unlock self-expression, and foster mental wellness. We’ll share personal stories, challenges, and triumphs that prove being different isn’t a weakness—it’s our superpower. Attendees will leave with new perspectives, encouragement, and practical tips for finding their own voice in the fan space. This is more than a discussion—it’s a celebration of resilience, creativity, and how fandom can truly change lives. Whether you’re a fan, a creator, or someone looking for inspiration, this is a panel where everyone belongs.
901300.people_list: Justin Santiago, Bianca Appiah, Daijonee Vanderveer, Joseph Munisteri, Nancy Amaro
people: Joseph Munisteri (Joseph Munisteri / Butterflies in Space LLC)

909802.title: DC Queer Trivia
909802.description:
DC Queer Trivia
1:00 PM to 2:00 PM

Test your Queer DC Trivia knowledge with the host of the Geeks OUT Podcast.

911687.title: Civics for All Comics Group at 5 (Years) and 5 Million (Copies)
911687.description: The New York City Department of Education’s Civics for All Comics Group just celebrated its fifth year in publishing in 2025. We also printed our five millionth comic and continue to be one of the ten largest comics publishers in the United States. Join a panel made up of the NYC team along with some of the different creators we work with to explore how we create our own comics, how the creators think about educational comics, and hear about the lessons we’ve learned and created. Meet with some of our creators and hear about some of the special comics projects that we have planned. And as always, our comics are FREE IN NYC and we will have lots of issues to give away at the panel.

909416.title: DanDaDan: Paranormal Chaos Meetup
909416.description:
Are you Team Momo, Okarun, or just here for the aliens, ghosts, and absolute mayhem? Whether you're into psychic battles, supernatural crushes, or just love the wild ride that is Dan Da Dan, this meetup is your spiritual home base. Come dressed as your favorite character or your favorite cryptid. Snap pics, swap theories, and maybe even reenact your favorite over-the-top scenes. 
It’s weird. It’s wild. It’s wonderfully unhinged. Just like Dan Da Dan. Let’s get paranormal at NYCC!

910417.title: Not Just Minecraft: Videogaming in the Classroom
910417.description:
This session will introduce educators to the popular and innovative ways that gamification has
transformed education.

910550.title: Judge This Book by Its Cover - Post Panel Book Signing
910550.description: Join authors from the "Judge This Book by Its Cover" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
910550.people_list: Jayson Green, Rob Hart, Jennifer Keishin Armstrong

902688.title: Telling Jewish Stories in YA Fiction
902688.description: Join a panel of award-winning authors in discussion of the hows and whys of Jewish storytelling in YA. We'll explore what brings together a diverse slate of stories -- from historical fiction brimming with magic to cutting-edge contemporary romance -- and discuss the different ways of making a novel "Jewish." We'll also dive into the importance of Jewish representation,  the challenges in bringing these stories to life, and look ahead for what the future holds in the world of Jewish YA.
902688.people_list: Sacha Lamb, AR Vishny, Andrea Max, Michal Schick, Lev Rosen

911148.title: Blast-A-Trooper
911148.description: Interactive experience to “blast” Stormtroopers and Mandalorians with foam dart blasters; fundraiser for charity led by 501st ECG and Mandalorian Mercs Falco Clan.

909122.title: Entire Universes In Your Pocket: The Future is Digital Comics with WEBTOON
909122.description: Comics have always been about storytelling that leaps off the page - but today’s series are just as likely to leap off your mobile phone screen. Join WEBTOON for a conversation about how digital comics are transforming the way we read, share, and connect with our favorite stories and characters from Marvel, Star Wars and beyond. From pull-lists and trade collections, to vertical-scrolling epics, the way we experience comics is evolving - and that’s a good thing. Whether you are a lifelong Marvel fan or a daily WEBTOON reader, this panel explores how the next generation of fans is finding their way to comics, what’s ahead for the format we all love and what it means to carry entire universes in your pocket.

909640.title: NCIS: TONY & ZIVA
909640.description: Scene stealing duo Tony and Ziva are back in NCIS: TONY & ZIVA, the newest installment of the NCIS franchise on Paramount+! The show fans have waited a decade for, finds Ziva and Tony reunited with their daughter Tali in Paris, only to be forced to go on the run across Europe after Tony’s security company is attacked. Join us for an action-packed screening followed by an exclusive conversation with series stars and executive producers Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly unraveling all the espionage, intrigue, and romance.

909494.title: Greeking Out: A Live Performance
909494.description: Join us for an live show of the wildly successful "Greeking Out" podcast by National Geographic Kids! Hosted by the dynamic duo, Kenny Curtis and Jillian Hughes, this panel will bring to life the clever, tongue-in-cheek retellings of classic Greek myths that have captivated audiences of all ages. Whether you're a long-time listener or new to the world of Greek myths, this panel is sure to delight and entertain. Don't miss your chance to see the all-knowing Oracle of Wi-Fi in action and discover the real myths behind your favorite characters. Perfect for kids, adults, and anyone with a love for history and mythology!

909495.title: Spotlight on Tim Blake Nelson
909495.description: Award-winning and acclaimed actor and writer Tim Blake Nelson will be on hand to discuss his forthcoming novel, Super Hero.

909814.title: Let's Learn UV Resin: Create your Own Resin Jewelry and Gems [Separately Ticketed]
909814.description: Dive into the world of resin with Cowbutt Crunchies in this beginner's intro course.  We'll learn the basics of how resin works, safety protocols, as well as the difference between various UV and Epoxy resins.  Students will be able to put their skills to the test as they create their own resin pendants and gemstones, using their choice of flowers, leaves, color tints, sparkles, or even spooky mix-ins! **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

909823.title: Making Queer Games and Making Games Queer
909823.description: Presented by Gayming Magazine and hosted by Qweerty  Gamers. The panel will discuss how Qweerty Gamers are developing and providing resources for LGBTQ devs and stories in an unpredictable time in the gaming industry.

909560.title: Original Comic Art: An Open Discussion with the Insiders
909560.description: Original Comic Art: An Open Discussion with the Insiders - moderated by Swagglehaus (Mickey Finnegan; online comic content creator) with special guests Dinesh Shamdasani (former CEO & CCO of Valiant Comics and current CEO & CCO of Bad Idea), Patrick A. Reed (curator of Marvel: Earth's Mightiest, Spider-Man: Beyond Amazing, and Jack Kirby: Heroes and Humanity), Michael Hansen (Xatari; private original art collector) and Stephen Shamus (President of ACE Experience and Co-Founder StarPics). An open discussion for all things Original Art - the panel will discuss current trends in comic art collecting, provide methods and tips for entering the hobby, spill the tea on past art deals, and host an open forum to answer all of your questions. There will even be a public viewing of carefully curated, iconic original pieces. You won't want to miss this. PLUS: Original Art giveaways!

911143.title: Spotlight on Todd McFarlane
911143.description: Comic legend Todd McFarlane shares what it really takes to create, build, and push past obstacles. From breaking into comics to navigating everyday challenges, Todd brings real talk, practical advice, and inspiration for fans, creators, and anyone chasing their goals

909633.title: MERCY: Exclusive First Look with Chris Pratt, Kali Reis & Timur Bekmambetov
909633.description: Step into the world of Mercy with Chris Pratt (actor), Kali Reis (actor), and Timur Bekmambetov (director/producer). Set in the near future, an LAPD detective (Pratt) wakes up strapped to an execution chair, on trial for murdering his wife. He has 90 minutes to prove his innocence to Judge Maddox (Rebecca Ferguson), an advanced A.I. system, or face immediate death. Get an exclusive first look at this high-stakes sci-fi crime thriller and hear directly from the cast and director as they reveal how they brought this race-against-time story to life! Mercy hits theaters Jan. 23, 2026.

911176.title: Jim Butcher Book Signing
911176.description: Jim Butcher, the bestselling and critically acclaimed author of the Dresden Files will be on hand to meet fans and sign books. One book personalized, up to three total books signed. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble at the front of Hall 1A.

904813.title: Go, Speed Racer, Go!: The Return of an Icon
904813.description: Start your engines and buckle up for a high-octane deep dive into the legendary world of Speed Racer! Join the creative team behind the brand-new Speed Racer comic series from Mad Cave Studios as they discuss reimagining one of the most iconic anime and manga properties of all time for a whole new generation of fans.

909408.title: Huntr/x Don’t Miss: A K-Pop Demon Hunters Meetup
909408.description:
Are you XQUAD or Pride? Or just vibing to the beats of KPop Demon Hunters? Whether you're a die-hard fan or just discovering the music, this is your call to arms (and glowsticks)!

🎶 Come meet fellow demon-slaying stans who live for the lore, the looks, and the legendary tracks. 🧝‍♀️ Cosplay your favorite characters or roll through in your chillest fit, either way, you're part of the squad. 📸 Expect photo ops, spontaneous dance breaks, and a great time all together.

This is more than a meetup, it’s a mission. Let’s make some noise, rep our factions, and show NYCC what a real fandom looks like.

909684.title: Icons and Activists: Comics for All Classrooms
909684.description:
In a time when engaging young people in the democratic process is more crucial than ever, comics have emerged as a powerful medium for education and activism. Join us for an enlightening panel that explores how comics can serve as dynamic tools for a variety of classroom instruction. This panel will discuss best practices for teaching with graphic texts including: Comics as a primary source, voter activation and civic education, using comics to engage students with different needs, helping students create comics to support literacy development, comics to integrate diverse voices in the social studies and ELA classroom.

 Attendees to this panel will walk away with free comics and a ton of new and innovative practices for their teacher tool kits.

903867.title: Pokémon Ecology Academy: Ancient Life
903867.description: Millions of years ago, strange and ancient Pokémon once roamed the world. From the fearsome Kabutops to the powerful Tyrantrum, these ancient creatures disappeared and were only known through fossils or legends. But through the research of scientists, these ancient creatures were restored and have returned to the world of Pokémon. In this panel paleontologists, biologists, and other experts from the Cosplay for Science Alliance dig deep into the science of ancient and fossil Pokémon! Learn how real-world fossils discoveries inspired favorites like Aerodactyl, Relicanth, Yanmega, and more. Discover how ancient Pokémon mirror big milestones in the history of life on Earth. Uncover the answers to questions like: How are fossils formed? Why did ancient insects become giants? Can extinct creatures be brought back to life? Did paleontologists ever accidentally mix up fossils like Dracovish? Featuring experts from Middlebury College, Utah State University, the Alf Museum of Paleontology, and the hit YouTube series, PBS Eons.
903867.people_list: Gregory Pask, Gabriel-Philip Santos, Alexis Mychajliw, Andrew Swafford, Lisa Lundgren

909824.title: GAYSIANS! Visibility, Voice & Victory
909824.description:
Representation matters—and the Gaysians have entered the chat! Join a stellar lineup of LGBTQ+ Asian  creators who are breaking barriers, challenging stereotypes, and making space for authentic stories in graphic novels, comics, TV, film, and beyond. Moderated by Erin Quill (actress, writer, Aveue-Q)

From drag to drama, stand-up to storytelling, this panel brings together actors, writers, singers, and comedians to share what it means to be both queer and Asian in today’s evolving entertainment landscape. Expect candid conversations, behind-the-scenes insights, and a celebration of the talent and resilience of this vibrant, often underrepresented community.

910419.title: Teaching Hidden Voices with Comics: Honoring the Stories of Asian American & Pacific Islanders
910419.description:
Participants will have an opportunity to sample various comics and make connections with the
AAPI curriculum. Join an expert panel that will feature prominent AAPI comic creators who will
share insights into how they researched, captured, and ultimately brought these important
characters and narratives to life.

910551.title: Greeking Out: A Live Performance - Post Panel Book Signing
910551.description: Join authors from the "Greeking Out" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.

911172.title: Telling Jewish Stories in YA Fiction - Post Panel Book Signing
911172.description: Join authors from the "Telling Jewish Stories in YA Fiction" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the signing tables.
911172.people_list: Sacha Lamb, Andrea Max, Lev Rosen, Michal Schick, AR Vishny

909496.title: Lost in Illustration: An Interactive Live Drawing Telephone Game
909496.description: Join these acclaimed illustrators for a game of Telephone: Drawing Edition! A member of the audience will pick a phrase and whisper it around the room. Once it has circulated, each illustrator will draw what they think the phrase was. Points will be given to the silliest picture! (Note: We’d love for at least one of these interactive drawing games to be selected.)
909496.people_list: Liz Montague, Trung Le Nguyen, Knack Whittle, Devin Elle Kurtz, Mika Song

910552.title: Spotlight on Tim Blake Nelson - Post Panel Book Signing
910552.description: Join award-winning and acclaimed actor and writer Tim Blake Nelson as he meets fans and signs books following his spotlight panel. One personalized book per person, no photos. Books are available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing tables.

904218.title: Comixology Presents: Lights, Camera…Comix!
904218.description:
Join actor Thomas Jane (The Expanse, The Punisher, The Lycan), TV and comic book writer Marc Bernardin (Star Trek Picard, Adora and the Distance, Eyes of Wakanda), TV and comic book writer Pornsak Pichetshote (Cloak & Dagger, The Horizon Experiment, The Good Asian), and TV and comic book writer Marc Guggenheim (The Arrowverse, Percy Jackson, The Adventures of Ulysses Monarch) as they discuss storytelling in both film/TV and comics, their passions, inspirations and latest comics projects.

Moderators: Brad and Lisa Gullickson, Comic Book Couples Counseling

909637.title: Apple TV+ presents “Slow Horses"
909637.description: Apple’s Emmy and BAFTA Award-winning hit espionage drama “Slow Horses” follows a dysfunctional team of British intelligence agents who serve in a dumping ground department of MI5 known affectionately as Slough House led by the brilliant but cantankerous Jackson Lamb, played by Academy Award winner Sir Gary Oldman. Join us for an exclusive panel featuring the misfit team of spies including Christopher Chung (“Roddy Ho”), James Callis (“Claude Whelan”), Ruth Bradley (“Emma Flyte”), and Tom Brooke (“JK Coe”), special season five guest star Nick Mohammed (“Zafar Jaffrey”) and Emmy Award-nominated director Saul Metzstein. “Slow Horses” season five will premiere globally with the first episode on September 24, 2025 on Apple TV+.
909637.people_list: Tom Brooke, Saul Metzstein, Ruth Bradley, Nick Mohammed, James Callis, Christopher Chung

909641.title: MARVEL COMICS: Spider-Man and his Venomous Friends
909641.description: Spider-Man’s in space and Mary Jane is Venom!? VP & Executive Editor Nick Lowe, Senior Editor Jordan D. White, Editor-in-Chief C.B. Cebulski, writer Al Ewing and other superstar creators dish about the wild developments currently taking place in Amazing Spider-Man, Venom, and more. Plus, get a sneak peek at what’s on the horizon from the shocking return of Knull to the mystery of the second Spider-Man! Webheads that stick around until the end will receive an exclusive giveaway comic!

909643.title: The Merch Nation: Avatar Legends Action Figures and Games
909643.description: Nickelodeon and its Avatar: The Last Airbender partners give a preview of the all-new toy and game lines for the next year with exclusive reveals. Stay until the end for trivia with a chance to win special prizes!

909497.title: Women in Fantasy: Shaping New Worlds
909497.description: Join these bestselling authors for an empowering discussion on the role of women in fantasy—both on the page and behind the pen. From crafting fierce heroines to building intricate magical worlds, these trailblazing storytellers will explore the challenges and triumphs of writing fantasy as women, the evolving landscape of the genre, and how they channel myth, romance, and rebellion into unforgettable tales.
909497.people_list: Alex Aster, Abigail Owen, Mai Corland, Laini Taylor, Delilah S. Dawson

903871.title: ¡Wepa! Puerto Ricans in the World of Comics
903871.description:
From October 4 to March 8, The New York Public Library will present an exhibition celebrating the creative legacy of Puerto Rican comic book creators across the Island and the mainland United States. Puerto Rico is sometimes called the U.S.’s forgotten colony, and these comics are an act of resistance against forgetting. They compel us to engage with Puerto Rico’s troubled political history, its complex relationship with the U.S., and its vulnerability to climate change, while also celebrating the richness and diversity of Puerto Rican culture.

This panel will be geared to educators and will address storytelling and identity through comic books. It will feature four of the exhibition’s artists – some from the island, some from the mainland U.S. –  along with the donor who gave the Library its unparalleled collection of 1600+ comics by and about Puerto Ricans. For more details on the collection, see here: https://www.nypl.org/blog/2023/10/27/new-archives-manuel-martinez-nazario-collection-puerto-ricans-world-comics-1950s

903120.title: PSA’s Guide to Comic Book & Pop Culture Grading & Collecting
903120.description:
The industry leader in third-party collectibles authentication and grading has officially launched comic book and magazine services. PSA is thrilled to leverage its expertise in this category and expand our offerings to uphold the highest standards of authenticity, condition assessment, preservation, and presentation.

Learn all about the comic collecting landscape, PSA’s new services and specific comic book and magazine 10-point grading scale with decimal increments. Then, get a behind-the-scenes look at PSA’s new holders and labels. Also learn all about PSA’s other Pop Culture categories. Plus, it’s your chance to ask your questions to PSA experts and participate in a giveaway.

TOPICS
Comic Collecting Landscape: Explore the comic collecting industry and the latest trends.
PSA’s Comic Book & Magazine Services: Take a look at PSA’s new services for your favorite books.
Comic Book & Magazine Grading Scale: Learn about the 10-point grading scale with decimal increments exclusively for this category.
Inside Our Label & Holder: See our new holder and get to know the new label for comics and magazines, including a gold label just for PSA 10 books.
PSA’s other Pop culture categories; TCG, Non-Sports, Funko Pops, and Video games.
PSA/ DNA: Autograph authentication for collectible items.
Q&A: Bring your questions directly to PSA experts.

909825.title: Book Signing and Meet and Greet
909825.description:
Mike Curato is a Filipino‑American author and illustrator, raised just outside New York City. He holds a BFA in Illustration from Syracuse University and began his career in children's publishing with the beloved Little Elliot picture book series. He also created the acclaimed YA graphic novel Flamer, which won the Lambda Literary Award and Massachusetts Book Award. 

Gaysians marks Curato’s debut graphic novel aimed at adult readers, released on June 3, 2025 by Algonquin Books.

894243.title: Dollar Store to Con Floor: Budget Crafting for Cosplay
894243.description: Expensive materials aren’t required for high-quality cosplays! Discover budget-friendly crafting techniques using dollar-store items, household materials, and alternative supplies to create armor, props, and accessories that look incredible without costing a fortune.

911149.title: Jedi Meditation
911149.description: Calling all Younglings! Learn tips and techniques used by the Jedi Masters themselves, or take a few moments of calm in your busy day at NYCC. Hosted by Saber Guild’s Empire Temple.

909420.title: Arcane Cosplay Meetup
909420.description: Attention Arcane fans and cosplayers! This is YOUR chance to connect with fellow fans and celebrate the world of Zaun and Piltover at New York Comic Con! Whether you're rocking a detailed Jinx cosplay or just showing up for your favorite blue-haired Zaunite orphan, this meetup is for ALL fans! Come together with others who share your love for the stunning animation, compelling characters, and epic storylines of Arcane (sing-alongs to Ma Meilleure Ennemie optional). From the towering ambitions of Mel and Ambessa to the pursuit of hextech by Jayce and Viktor to the gritty underworld of Silco and Sevika, we’ll be gathering to chat, take photos, and celebrate the world of Arcane in a fun, inclusive environment. This is your chance to make new friends, share your theories (we see you, Jayvik fans), and get lost in the magic of Arcane in the heart of NYCC. See you there!

903876.title: Your Origin Story: Turning Your Passion into a Dream Job with WEBTOON
903876.description: Ever dreamed of making comics for a living? You’re not alone! The rise of the Creator Economy has changed the game, giving artists and storytellers more freedom than ever to turn their passion into a full-time career. But how do you make that leap from hobbyist to pro? Join a lineup of incredible WEBTOON creators who’ve done just that as they share their journeys—breaking down the highs, the hustle, and the reality of making comics your career.

909815.title: Mixed Material Embroidery with Ribbon, Beads, and Floss [Separately Ticketed]
909815.description: Looking to add a couture touch to your costumes? Layering and combining materials is a fantastic way to create depth and texture in your embroidery work.  In this class Cowbutt Crunchies will teach hand embroidery techniques such as basic stitches, ribbon embroidery, beading, and more to create beautiful, dimensional floral embellishments that can be added to your next costume. **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

904206.title: Play, Craft, Learn: Minecraft Education In The Classroom
904206.description:
In 2020, Mashfiq Ahmed started an afterschool virtual Minecraft Club in order for his students to de-stress and socialize with each other during remote learning. However, it quickly became something bigger than what anyone could have imagined. In the past few years, Mr. Ahmed and his students have participated in and won esports championships, ran a Minecraft Student Ambassador program, received global recognition, and so much more!

Join Mr. Ahmed and his students in this panel where they discuss and share their experiences with Minecraft in the classroom and the impact of game-based learning.
904206.people_list: Mashfiq Ahmed, Louis Savino, Jerry Zhou, Kimberly Savino, Esraa Luna

911381.title: Panel Coming Soon
911381.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

911173.title: Lost in Illustration - Post Panel Book Signing
911173.description: Join author/illustrators from the "Lost in Translation" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
911173.people_list: Devin Elle Kurtz, Liz Montague, Trung Le Nguyen, Mika Song, Knack Whittle

910424.title: Hard History Through Comics
910424.description:
Using comics to engage students in learning about historical events and people that can often
be seen as controversial or uncomfortable. Attendees will receive strategies and frameworks for
incorporating comics for teaching and learning the critical topics that often times educators
avoid for fear of treading into challenging history.

911595.title: RESERVATION REQUIRED - Matt Dinniman Book Signing
911595.description: Join bestselling author Matt Dinniman, best known for the Dungeon Crawler Carl series, as he greets fans and signs books. PLEASE NOTE: A reservation is required for this event. In addition to the reservation, you must purchase any Dungeon Crawler Carl book from the Barnes & Noble booth (at the front of Hall 1A) to join the signing line. Proof of purchase will be required. In order for Mr. Dinniman to meet the largest number of fans, there is a limit of two books signed per person. Reservations will open on September 29. Information about NYCC reservations.

909498.title: Grab Your Cape: Drawing Inspiration from Heroes and Comics
909498.description: It’s a bird! It’s a plane! No, it’s a graphic novel! No one knows the importance of heroes more than these creators who evoke the classic superhero tradition with their action-packed, spectacular, and highly kinetic new graphics.
909498.people_list: George O'Connor, Ngozi Ukazu, Marian Dealy

911179.title: Women in Fantasy - Post Panel Book Signing
911179.description: Join authors from the "Women in Fantasy" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.  Oner book personalized, up to three total books signed. No posed photos.
911179.people_list: Alex Aster, Mai Corland, Delilah S. Dawson, Abigail Owen, Laini Taylor

903761.title: Unmasking Jewish Identity in the Marvel Universe
903761.description:
Calling all Marvel fans! Join a powerhouse panel of comic book historians, writers, and pop culture experts as they dive deep into Marvel's Jewish superhero history.  From Kitty Pryde's strength, to Magneto's history as a Holocaust survivor, to Billy Kaplan, Ben Grimm, Arnie Roth, and tons of characters you may not even know about—this expert panel unpacks how Jewish characters have been written, how their identity is portrayed, and the impact it has on readers of all ages.   

Fans of the MCU will also enjoy this panel as we look at the strides Marvel has made with Jewish superheroes and provide additional behind-the-scenes insights.
903761.people_list: Jennifer Caplan, Aleksandra Chernyak, Roy Schwartz, Daniel Fingeroth

909499.title: How About A Love Story? (presented by Cosmo Reads)
909499.description: Presented by Cosmo Reads, Tamara Fuentes (Cosmopolitan's entertainment editor) will lead a thoughtful discussion with some of the industry's bestselling authors of romance, romantasy and women's fiction on why this genre is having a cultural "moment" and how it inspires female empowerment despite the often-underestimated appeal of anything created by and for women. Featured authors include Iman Hariri-Kia (Cosmo Reads), Alysha Rameera (Casablanca), K.A. Linde (Bloom), Kate Dramis (Casablanca), KJ Micciche (Cosmo Reads). Official book signing to follow.
909499.people_list: K. A. Linde, Iman Hariri-Kia, Alysha Rameera, Kate Dramis, K.J. Micciche, Tamara Fuentes

904413.title: GLITCH PRODUCTIONS PRESENTS - The Cast of The Amazing Digital Circus
904413.description: Amazing Digital Circus, the YouTube sensation now also on Netflix, is bringing the entire main cast AND the creator of the show GOOSEWORX, together to reveal tales from the production, talk about their journeys as VAs, and take questions from their avid fans. The panel will feature Lizzie Freeman (voice of Pomni, Pokémon Horizons, Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure), Michael Kovach (voice of Jax, Murder Drones, Lackadaisy), Alex Rochon (voice of Caine; Poppy Playtime), Amanda Hufford (voice of Ragatha; Date Everything), Marissa Lenti (voice of Gangle; Borderlands 3), Ashley Nichols (voice of Zooble; Far-Fetched, Lackadaisy). Get your questions answered and see what's next for THE AMAZING DIGITAL CIRCUS and GLITCH PRODUCTIONS as well!

904440.title: Misogynoir and Multiverses: A Black Girl’s Guide to Fandom Culture
904440.description:
Misogynoir and Multiverses—culture writer Noella Williams’ (Teen Vogue, Vox, Uproxx) forthcoming debut novel—is an exploration of the racism and sexism directed toward Black women and femmes in the science fiction and fantasy communities. 

Although fandom culture can provide a sense of community and expression, it can also be a toxic environment, especially when you have intersectional identities like being Black, femme, and queer. Between forming community with other Black women nerds and analyzing harmful tropes, both the book and this panel will celebrate Black women in fandom and highlight the brilliant Black actresses who have blazed a trail.
904440.people_list: Nadira Goffe, Jordan Brown, Noella Williams, Kaitlyn McNab

909638.title: Prime Video’s Cross
909638.description: Prime Video’s hit series Cross, based on the worldwide bestselling novels by James Patterson, returns to the New York Comic Con stage with an exclusive first look at the second season of the thrilling crime drama. Star Aldis Hodge is back as Detective Alex Cross, joined by additional cast and creatives for a darker, jaw-dropping, and more unpredictable new season. The panel will reveal shocking new cases, high-stakes revelations, and the intense character moments that have made Cross a standout hit.

909405.title: Welcome to the Velvet Room: Persona Meetup
909405.description: Want to meet up with other members of S.E.E.S? Eager to join the Phantom theives? Let's save the world from Shadows and end the school year successfully!

904815.title: BAD IDEA: The New York Comic Con Panel
904815.description: The next wave of BAD IDEA comics continues right here! Join mastermind Derek Kolstad, creator and writer of the JOHN WICK franchise of movies, New York Times best-selling writer Matt Kindt, Eisner-nominated writer Joshua Dysart, modern comic art phenomenon, Jonathan Wayshak, and BAD IDEA impresarios Dinesh Shamdasani, Peter Stern, Benjamin Simpson, and Siena Fallon for an exclusive look at BAD IDEA's biggest slate yet! Witness brand-new art from PLANET DEATH, ORDAINED, SURVIVE, CUL-DE-SAC, HABITAT, WARBIRD, and much more! Plus, special guests AND a convention exclusive giveaway!

909735.title: RoboCop: 35 Years of Justice
909735.description: “Serve the public trust. Protect the innocent. Uphold the law.” Return to Old Detroit as Peter Weller (Alex Murphy/RoboCop) and Nancy Allen (Officer Anne Lewis) reunite to celebrate the enduring legacy of RoboCop. From its razor-sharp satire to its groundbreaking sci-fi action, RoboCop redefined the genre and left an indelible mark on pop culture. Hear behind-the-scenes stories, explore the film’s impact over the decades, and revisit what made the partnership between RoboCop and Officer Lewis so iconic. Whether you're a longtime fan or new to the force—this is one directive you won’t want to miss.
909735.people_list: Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Ashley V Robinson

910562.title: Grab Your Cape - Post Panel Book Signing
910562.description: Join authors from the "Grab Your Cape" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
910562.people_list: Marian Dealy, George O'Connor, Ngozi Ukazu

909804.title: Making a Cosplay Prop with Masked Dad Workshop [Reservation Required]
909804.description: Learn to build a cosplay prop with Masked Dad Workshop, a cosplay supply company founded by two dads of color in NYC. This hands-on workshop will teach you essential tips and tricks to get started, and give you the chance to ask questions in person with experienced, award-winning cosplayers. **A reservation Is required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

903866.title: From the Guild Archives: Natural History of Monster Hunter
903866.description: Hunter, to protect the monsters of the surrounding area, the Guild authorizes you access to the science notes of Monster Hunter! In this panel from the Cosplay for Science Alliance, discover the natural history behind the incredible monsters of the Monster Hunter franchise and learn about the amazing ways our world has inspired iconic monsters like Rathalos and Anjanath. We’ll answer questions like: Are the sizes of monsters realistic? How does the classification of monsters work? Do any real-life animals have features like those seen in Monster Hunter? Come talk biology, ecology, ethology, and every other -ology with us about the Monster Hunter franchise! Featuring Dr. Kiersten Formoso, Rutgers University paleontologist and science consultant for Prehistoric Planet; Dr. Khanh To, dinosaur expert and Texas A&M University paleontologist; and Gabriel-Philip Santos, cohost of PBS Eons and Director of Education at the Alf Museum of Paleontology.
903866.people_list: Gabriel-Philip Santos, Brenen Wynd, Kiersten Formoso

911590.title: NEON ICHIBAN: The Future of Digital Comics & Manga
911590.description:
Discover Neon Ichiban, a new all-in-one digital comics and manga hub from David Steinberger and Chip Mosher. Launching with a stellar line up of  publishers—(in alphabetical order) Dark Horse Comics, DC, DSTLRY, Kodansha, Marvel Comics, Oni Press, Vault Comic and more to be announced—NEON ICHIBAN lets fans read, buy, sell, and collect digital comics like never before.
This panel offers a first look at key features: same-day releases, limited digital collectibles, resellable digital comics, and Neon Ichiban’s exclusive remarques technology—where creators can sign and sketch on your digital comics. If you love comics, manga and innovation, this is your new home.

910553.title: How About A Love Story? -- Post Panel Book Signing
910553.description: Join authors from the "How About a Love Story" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
910553.people_list: Kate Dramis, Iman Hariri-Kia, K. A. Linde, Alysha Rameera

910561.title: How About A Love Story? - Post Panel Book Signing
910561.description: Join authors from the "How About a Love Story" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
910561.people_list: Kate Dramis, Iman Hariri-Kia, K. A. Linde, Alysha Rameera

909634.title: FX’s "Alien: Earth” - Moderated Q&A and Screening – FEAR TAKES NEW FORMS.
909634.description: FX’s "Alien: Earth” crash-lands at New York Comic Con for the first time! Join series creator Noah Hawley, EP David W. Zucker (Scott Free) and the cast of this critically acclaimed sci-fi horror series for an unforgettable discussion. Inspired by the acclaimed feature film franchise, FX’s "Alien: Earth” follows a young woman (Sydney Chandler) and a ragtag group of tactical soldiers who make a fateful discovery that puts them face-to-face with the planet’s greatest threat. FX’s "Alien: Earth” airs Tuesdays at 8pm ET/PT on FX and is available to stream on Hulu.

909642.title: Adult Swim Presents: Genndy Tartakovsky’s Primal Season 3 - Everything You Wanted to Know
909642.description: After winning five Emmy® Awards including Outstanding Animated Program, the third season of Genndy Tartakovksy’s Primal is set to return to Adult Swim. Join animation legend Genndy Tartakovsky (Dexter’s Laboratory, Samurai Jack, Sym-Bionic Titan, Unicorn: Warriors Eternal) for a first look at the third season of the acclaimed animated series produced by Cartoon Network Studios.

909644.title: Panel Coming Soon
909644.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

900950.title: Headlocked Comics and Masked Republic: Taking Wrestling Beyond The Ring
900950.description: Mike Johhson (PWInsider) leads a discussion of the intersection of wrestling and comics, how they've influenced each other, and how Headlocked Comics and Masked Republic have led that charge for the past decade. Featuring Headlocked creator Mike Kingston and creators and wrestlers who have participated in these iconic mashups. It all leads into the reveal of Headlocked Comics and Masked Republic's upcoming slate of projects with some huge announcements featuring collaborations by the biggest names in professional wrestling and lucha libre.

910427.title: Pep & Hugh's Queer History 101 Book Club featuring George Takei
910427.description:
Peppermint and Hugh Ryan are hosts of a popular podcast on Queer history and books. For this
special episode, taped during the panel, the hosts will discuss queer representation in comics
and focus on a few comics that are about queer history.

909430.title: DC Universe Rogues and Villains Meetup
909430.description:
Calling all villains, rogues and evil doers of the DC Universe. DC Cosplayers East will be hosting a meetup dedicated to those cosplayers of injustice causing chaos in Gotham, Metropolis and the DC Universe. Whether you cosplay Joker, Riddler, Bizarro, Lex Luthor or any other DC villain, please join us Thursday, October 9th at 630PM at the north tower. Check out our event page on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/events/800401518999346

In addition you can join us for our classic DC Universe cosplay meetup which all heroes and villains of the DC world are welcome and will take place Thursday, October 9th at 3PM by the staircase on the first floor at the special events hall. You can check out that event page on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/events/566173009875328
909430.people_list: Robert Burdi, Sophia Elwell, Carlos Smith, Angelo Maione, Michael Gilbert, Izabelle Garcia, Taylor Van Ackem

900996.title: Superpowered Comedy Show (18+)
900996.description: In an electrifying 90-minute comedy show, we will bring together a superpowered lineup of comedians who are as passionate about pop culture as they are about comedy. Expect jokes on everything from superheroes and sci-fi to fantasy and fandoms. Whether you’re a die-hard fan or just looking for a good laugh, this show will have geeky references for everyone. Join us for this unique experience of unwinding with a crowd that shares your love for all things nerdy while enjoying top-tier comedy.

909500.title: Your Next Book Obsession: Spotlight on Tor Publishing Group
909500.description: Tor Publishing Group publishes some of the greatest sci-fi, fantasy, romance, and horror books around. This panel will shine a spotlight on some of the exciting upcoming titles that Tor, Tor Teen, Tordotcom Publishing, Nightfire, and our newest imprint, Bramble, have to offer. Join the book lovers from the Tor teams as they share a sneak peek at new and upcoming books that you will definitely have to add to your TBR list.

904430.title: Comic Book Bans on Trial
904430.description: Attempts to censor comics, graphic novels, and manga reached new heights in 2025, and the Comic Book Legal Defense Fund is on the case! In this panel, creators, lawyers, and other industry leaders will discuss the newest developments in protecting free expression through the comic arts. Have recent court rulings made book bans legal? Is manga being banned in Texas and New York? What's the latest on the CBLDF's lawsuit against mandatory ratings? Are international comics creators at risk in the U.S.? As comics censorship cases make their way to the Supreme Court, the CBLDF returns to New York Comic-Con to explain what's happening, why it matters, and what's next.

909836.title: Traction Park Massacre: World Premiere Screening of the new horror film inspired by Action Park
909836.description:
Get ready for epic thrills at New York Comic Con with the world premiere of Traction Park Massacre, the new horror film inspired by the infamous Action Park, the most dangerously fun amusement park of the ’80s and ’90s.

Be the first to witness Traction Park Massacre before anyone else, with directors Adam Dubin and Douglas diMonda, along with select cast members in attendance. To cap it off, we’ll be giving away an original signed lithograph print created by Tony Squindo, an artist who has created designs for Metallica, The Misfits, and more. This blood splattered slasher is a film experience you won’t want to miss.
909836.people_list: Tony Squindo, Douglas DiMonda, Adam Dubin

909714.title: Cookie Run: Learn to Play Experience at NYCC
909714.description:
Step into the whimsical world of Cookie Run at New York Comic Con! Whether you’re a seasoned gamer or brand new to the franchise, our Learn to Play activation is the perfect way to jump in. Guided by our friendly demo team, you’ll explore the vibrant Cookie Run Kingdom, master the core rules, and experience the excitement of gameplay firsthand.

Come for the fun, stay for the cookie. No prior experience required - let’s play!

909501.title: Battle of the Tropes
909501.description: A comic convention favorite is coming in back for another round of chaos! Battle of the Tropes pits teams of authors against each other in an argument for the ages. Think part game show, part debate, and part improv. Audience members provide tropes for the teams to debate and decide the winner of each round with sheer volume. Whether you're team chosen one or long for only one bed situations, these enemies will become lovers again at the end of the session.
909501.people_list: Axie Oh, Page Powars, Kat Cho, Travis Baldree, Stephanie Carr

909403.title: It Was NEVER a Phase Mom!
909403.description: A meetup of anime, comics, video games, and pop culture fans who are starting to feel a little old.

909503.title: Fall's Most Anticipated YA Books (Simon & Schuster)
909503.description: From breakout debut to buzzy new series and a beloved returning voice, this panel features three must-read YA releases that are redefining what’s next in teen fiction. Chloe Gong (Coldwire), Rebecca Danzenbaker (Soulmatch), and Joelle Wellington (Girls Who Play Dead) dive into fractured futures, buried secrets, and the perilous cost of survival. With virtual wars, soul-deep conspiracies, and twisty small-town mysteries, these authors are serving up high-stakes storytelling that will keep you turning pages—and sleeping with one eye open.
909503.people_list: Chloe Gong, Joelle Wellington, Rebecca Danzenbaker

910564.title: The Comic Industry Mixer Presented by Comic Sketch Art
910564.description:
ATTN: Comic Industry Pros – this event is for you! If you have a ticket type such as: Artist Alley, Writers Block, Pro Thursday, Pro 4-Day, Press, Content Creator, Exhibitor, Panelist or Sidekick - join us for The Comic Industry Mixer Presented by Comic Sketch Art at 8:00 PM. The evening will feature industry heavyweight keynote speakers. Connect with budding and established professionals alike; light food and beverages will be served. 

Keynote Speakers 
Dal Bush and Patrick Brower (owners Challenger’s Comics + Conversation, Chicago) 
Tom King (Supergirl Woman of Tomorrow)  
Courtney Menard Director of Production Tiny Onion 

The Pro-Mixer Industry Event Bar is Sponsored by IDW Publishing and Swag Bags are Sponsored by Yen Press.

909410.title: Creatures of the Night and other Monsters
909410.description: Come one come all. If you have a horror theme cosplay, this is the place for you. From Zombies, to Vampires, to Ghosts. Your cosplay can be original or from a known franchise (From any movie, book, comics, anime, whichever). We want you here to show your best spooky outfit and pose.

911623.title: Tomi Adeyemi Book Signing
911623.description: Join Instant #1 New York Times-bestselling & Hugo-award winning fantasy author sensation Tomi Adeyemi as she greets fans and signs books. One book personalized, up to three total books signed, no posed photos. Books will be available for purchase at the Barnes & Noble booth adjacent to the author signing tables.

902666.title: Make your Own Badge Ribbon
902666.description: To attend this workshop - it is first come, first served. Limited space is available. Get crafty and stand out on the con floor! Join us for a fun, hands-on session where you can design and create your very own custom badge ribbons to express your fandom, mood, or memes. Whether you’re repping your favorite character, adding flair to your cosplay, or just love shiny things, this is the perfect way to personalize your con experience. We’ll have all the supplies you need, including ribbon, letter stickers, glitter, washi tape, and more. All skill levels welcome, just bring your creativity and leave with a ribbon that’s totally you!

911128.title: Hasbro Toy Panel – Action Brands
911128.description: Hasbro’s brand marketing and design teams return to NYCC with an action-packed showcase of its iconic action figure lines. Fans can expect updates from TRANSFORMERS, including preorder timing for recently revealed items, including Studio Series. The panel will also introduce new additions to the G.I. JOE Classified Series, with a first look at a covert new vehicle designed for icy terrain.  Plus, Ghostbusters fans won’t want to miss behind-the-scenes info on the latest Kenner Classics collection news.  Join Hasbro’s team for exclusive reveals, behind-the-scenes insights, and a glimpse at what’s next in action figure storytelling.

909645.title: Paramount Pictures presents The Running Man
909645.description: Writer/Director Edgar Wright joins stars Glen Powell and Lee Pace for an exclusive look at this fall’s adrenaline-fueled, action-packed theatrical event. Adapted from the acclaimed best seller by Stephen King, The Running Man is only in theatres this November.

896853.title: Cosplay in the Neurodivergent Community
896853.description: This panel features neurodivergent and disabled cosplayers discussing how to adapt costumes to meet their unique needs while staying true to the character. Topics include practical modifications, sensory-friendly fabric alternatives, and tips for making cosplay more accessible. The panel also includes an audience Q&A, fostering an open discussion about the challenges and triumphs of being neurodivergent or disabled in the cosplay community.
896853.people_list: Alexandra Koza, Jesse Paratore, David Lehmkuhl

908894.title: Nickelodeon x Magic: The Gathering
908894.description: Get your exclusive first look at the next powerful team-up between Magic: The Gathering and Nickelodeon. It's going to be [redacted]!
908894.people_list: Stephanie Cheung, Eric Englehard, Crystal Frasier

909406.title: Mario Kart StreetPass 3D World Meetup
909406.description:
Feeling Nostalgic while still enjoying the modern changes of Portable gaming? Well you're not alone! Snag your 3ds family of handhelds and grab a Dash Food at Yoshi's to Experience a Live and in your face meetup of Streetwise Proportions! Come on Dress Downed to the Marked location at this specific time to: Trade Street Passes or Play 3DS games, with/or Without a group of colorful -and Dare we say DASHIONABLE- Cosplayers of the Hit Switch 2 game: Mario Kart World!* 

*NPCs/Bowser Minions Welcomed.

909505.title: Spotlight on Veronica Roth
909505.description: The #1 New York Times bestselling author of When Among Crows, the Divergent Series,  Chosen Ones, Poster Girl, and more, will be on hand to discuss her latest work, To Clutch a Razor, the second book in the Curse Bearer series.

911055.title: The Return of Backyard Sports: Celebrating the Joy of the Game
911055.description: The panel will explore the creation of multi-generational storytelling in a multi-platform, endlessly fractured media environment. Playground Productions bought the rights to the Backyard Sports franchise in 2022, and has since relaunched the classic titles for modern consoles to enormous success. This panel seeks to understand how to tap into the original audience while expanding into evolving and new audiences.
911055.people_list: Jennifer Aronson, James Deighan, Lindsay Barnett, Christopher Waters

909816.title: Organics, Textures, and Detailing: The Art of Foamwork  [Separately Ticketed]
909816.description: Hungry to give your armor and foamwork projects a more detailed flare?  Texturizing is a fantastic way to breathe life into flat foam, and this class from Cowbutt Crunchies will touch on numerous different ways to approach adding texture for a more complex look.  Students will have the chance to create various eva foam samples to take home as they try out woodburning tools, glues, and stamps, followed by a more organic approach using foam clay. **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

904285.title: Grading 101 with CGC Comics
904285.description: Join CGC Comics grading experts Matt Nelson and Shawn Caffrey for an in-depth panel on comic book grading and preservation. The panel will have a behind-the-scenes look at how comics get graded at CGC. Plus, watch live grading demos, learn how to spot pressable defects and restoration and get expert insight into what really affects a comic's grade. You'll also get the chance to guess the grade for prizes, test your knowledge with comic book trivia and ask questions during an open Q&A. Whether you're a seasoned collector or just love comics, this panel is packed with helpful tips and insider knowledge you won't want to miss!

909159.title: Nacelle’s Star Trek Action Figures
909159.description: Brian Volk-Weiss (The Toys That Made Us, Disney’s Behind the Attraction) and Nacelle Toys join us for an intergalactic deep dive into their officially licensed Star Trek action figure line, featuring an exclusive first look at the renders for wave two and a sneak peek at wave three! Brace for impact, because Nacelle’s materializing something stellar for your Star Trek collection.

911617.title: RESERVATION REQUIRED - Matt Dinniman Book Signing
911617.description: Join bestselling author Matt Dinniman, best known for the Dungeon Crawler Carl series, as he greets fans and signs books. PLEASE NOTE: A reservation is required for this event. In addition to the reservation, you must purchase any Dungeon Crawler Carl book from the Barnes & Noble booth (at the front of Hall 1A) to join the signing line. Proof of purchase will be required. In order for Mr. Dinniman to meet the largest number of fans, there is a limit of two books signed per person. Reservations will open on September 29. Information about NYCC reservations.

911380.title: Panel Coming Soon
911380.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

905842.title: Kodansha's Upcoming Series Debuts & New Licenses
905842.description: Kodansha—purveyors of some of the most exciting & heartfelt manga published today like, Blue Lock, Gachiakuta and Witch Hat Atelier and more—invites manga veterans and newbies alike to get a special sneak peek of some of the hottest new series and latest license coming soon to a bookshelf near you! Hear from the manga experts at Kodansha as they detail an upcoming year of huge manga debuts, offer recommendations for soon-to-debut releases and even hand out some special manga giveaways. It’s a panel no manga fan can miss!

909739.title: The Cast of Alien
909739.description:
"Blast off into the chilling world of Alien with Sigourney Weaver (Ellen Ripley), Tom Skerritt (Dallas), and Veronica Cartwright (Lambert)! This legendary panel, moderated by Josh Horowitz, takes fans behind the scenes of the iconic sci-fi horror film that redefined the genre.

The cast will share unforgettable stories from the set—from nerve-wracking encounters with the film’s groundbreaking creature effects to the intense dynamics of working aboard the Nostromo. Discover how they brought their characters to life under director Ridley Scott’s visionary guidance and what it was like to face one of cinema’s most terrifying monsters. With Josh Horowitz steering the conversation, this panel promises insight, nostalgia, and a few surprises from the actors who helped make Alien a timeless classic."
909739.people_list: Sigourney Weaver, Tom Skerritt, Veronica Cartwright, Josh Horowitz

909709.title: Playbill presents: BEETLEJUICE on Broadway
909709.description: Big musical comedy is alive — or should we say, undead — on Broadway! Based on Tim Burton’s dearly beloved film, BEETLEJUICE tells the story of Lydia Deetz, a strange and unusual teenager whose whole life changes when she meets a recently deceased couple and a demon with a thing for stripes. With an irreverent book, an astonishing set, and a score that’s out of this Netherworld, BEETLEJUICE is “A FEAST FOR THE EYES AND SOUL!” (Entertainment Weekly). Trust us — this panel is sure to raise your spirits!

911150.title: Jedi Meditation
911150.description: Calling all Younglings! Learn tips and techniques used by the Jedi Masters themselves, or take a few moments of calm in your busy day at NYCC. Hosted by Saber Guild’s Empire Temple.

911089.title: Pop Cultr Marketing Summit Session One: Live Engagement & Events
911089.description: Learn why live experiences are an essential marketing strategy as digital attention spans fragment, and audiences crave authentic connection.

909433.title: Spider-Verse vs. Villains Cosplay Meetup
909433.description:
Step into the Multiverse—and bring your best pose!
Calling all Spider-People and the rogues who haunt them! Whether you’re swinging in as Miles Morales, Gwen Stacy, Miguel O’Hara, or cosplaying iconic villains like Green Goblin, Venom, or Spot, this high-energy meetup is your chance to shine. Come ready for epic photo ops, crossover moments, and battles that span dimensions. Let’s see who runs the multiverse—heroes or villains?

Check out the FB event: https://www.facebook.com/share/1B6Cs8jRKw/

910554.title: Spotlight on Veronica Roth - Post Panel Book Signing
910554.description: Join, Veronica Roth, the award-winning and acclaimed author of the Divergent Series, The Chosen Ones, Poster Girl, and many other books, as she greets fans and signs books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.

909569.title: DC Comics: Gotham City
909569.description: Walk the dark and gritty streets of the DC Universe with top DC comic book creators for news and surprises involving Batman and the other protectors of Gotham City. Moderated by DC Group Editor Rob Levin.

909715.title: Cookie Run: Learn to Play Experience at NYCC
909715.description:
Step into the whimsical world of Cookie Run at New York Comic Con! Whether you’re a seasoned gamer or brand new to the franchise, our Learn to Play activation is the perfect way to jump in. Guided by our friendly demo team, you’ll explore the vibrant Cookie Run Kingdom, master the core rules, and experience the excitement of gameplay firsthand.

Come for the fun, stay for the cookie. No prior experience required - let’s play!

909507.title: Voices in the Dark: The Art of Horror Audiobooks
909507.description: "Scary stories are best told aloud." It's an adage as old as the campfire—and in today's booming audio landscape, horror audiobooks keep that primal thrill alive (or undead). Join a chilling lineup of voice actors and creatives as they pull back the curtain on what it takes to terrify through sound alone. Why is horror uniquely suited to audio? How do narrators embody fear, tension, and monstrous characters with just their voice? And how do producers wield pacing and sound design to amplify dread? Expect behind-the-scenes tales from recording booths where even the narrators got spooked. Whether you're a longtime listener or simply love a good scare, this panel invites you deep into the dark—and leaves you wondering what's lurking just beyond the headphones.
909507.people_list: Nick Medina, Nick Martorelli, Jeremy Carlisle Parker, Shaun Taylor-Corbett

909508.title: Ann M. Martin and The Baby-sitters Club: Then, Now, and Always
909508.description: Celebrate the enduring legacy of The Baby-sitters Club! Join creator Ann M. Martin as she reflects on the beloved series that became a global phenomenon. Spanning 250+ titles, graphic novel adaptations, TV shows, and a feature film, hear what’s next for the iconic series that continues to inspire, influence, and resonate with readers of all ages.

909509.title: Spotlight on Hafsah Faizal
909509.description: Join #1 New York Times and Indie-bestselling author Hafsah Faizal as she discusses her deliciously twisty and seductive romantic vampire fantasy duology finale, A STEEPING OF BLOOD. This spotlight program will also explore her journey to published author - did you know she started as a web designer and book influencer before publishing her epic debut We Hunt the Flame, which became an instant bestseller, heralded a 'best book' by TIME Magazine?! Now she’s a Forbes 30 under 30 honoree and one of the most beloved YA fantasy authors today.

903890.title: Rooster Fighter English Dub World Premiere
903890.description: Who’s ready to cluck around and find out? Be the first to watch the Rooster Fighter English dub episode 1 world premiere! Witness Keiji as he pecks his way through demons and defends innocent humans in this action-packed anime! So fly on by to win some poultry-themed prizes!

909805.title: Making a Cosplay Prop with Masked Dad Workshop [Reservation Required]
909805.description: Learn to build a cosplay prop with Masked Dad Workshop, a cosplay supply company founded by two dads of color in NYC. This hands-on workshop will teach you essential tips and tricks to get started, and give you the chance to ask questions in person with experienced, award-winning cosplayers. **A reservation Is required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

911151.title: Star Wars Meetup
911151.description:
Whether you’re on the light side or the dark side, all Star Wars cosplayers and fans are welcome to this meetup hosted by Rebel Legion’s Echo Base.

Star Wars Meetup (Friday):  
https://www.facebook.com/share/1FGaPbHLb9/?mibextid=wwXIfr
911151.people_list: Lisa Giunta-Popeil,  Rebel Legion - Echo Base

906675.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Empire City – World Premiere Gameplay
906675.description: Join creative director Ace St. Germain and story consultant Tom Waltz (IDW's TMNT comics, The Last Ronin) on stage for the gameplay world premiere of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Empire City, the first ever Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles game in VR. Ace and Tom will give a first glimpse of the game in action, talk about the story, setting, and characters, and answer questions from the audience.

904419.title: A LIVE COMIC PODCAST CROSSOVER EVENT: The Short Box Meets Comic Book Couples Counseling meets The Oblivion Bar meets Off Panel
904419.description: LIVE FROM NYCC, four of the best comic podcasts will come together to record a LIVE crossover show! Join the hosts of The Short Box Podcast, Comic Book Couples Counseling, The Oblivion Bar, and Off Panel for a live comic podcast show celebrating the best comics, and creators, of the year (so far!), with plenty of other surprises!
904419.people_list: Badr Milligan, David Harper, Aaron Knowles

908262.title: Toei Animation Presents: ONE PIECE Panel
908262.description: Join Toei Animation for an exciting look at what's next in the world of ONE PIECE. Featuring special guests and exclusive conversations around the anime’s latest developments and beyond. You won’t want to miss a few surprises planned just for NYCC!

909681.title: Enter MAYA, The Brand-New Multimedia Sci-Fi Fantasy Franchise From Department Of Lore
909681.description: Join Award Winning film director: Anand Gandhi (Tumbbad, Ship of Theseus) and acclaimed game maker: Zain Memon (Shasn) as they invite fans into the world of Maya where immortality is a commodity, and minds are shaped, choices nudged, and futures manufactured - invisibly, systemically.
