Launched with the novel MAYA: Seed Takes Root, and continuing through board games and into graphic novels, the creators will share behind-the-scenes information, stunning visuals, and upcoming news.

911090.title: Pop Cultr Marketing Summit Session Two: Tabletop Games
911090.description: Learn how TTGs and TTCs create brands people belong to, and the strategies driving their passionate communities.

911373.title: Joe Hill Book Signing
911373.description: Bestselling and critically acclaimed author Joe Hill will be on hand to meet fans and sign books. One book personalized, up to three total books signed, no posed photos. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble at the front of Hall 1A.

909427.title: Wrestling Cosplay Meetup
909427.description:
Calling all wrestlers, managers, referees, and fans!
Let’s get ready to rumble in the squared circle for the 3rd Annual NYCC Wrestling Cosplay Meetup!

We’re paying homage to the greatest wrestlers of the past, present, and future! Stop by to show off your gear, talk wrestling, film content, defend your title, and cut a promo with other superstars.

All wrestling fans are welcome! Hosted by The Machoverse, ItsJackInTheBox, and The World Wrestling Cosplayers. 

Check out our Facebook event page here: https://www.facebook.com/share/1CFogCP8bH/
people: John De Benedetto (It's Jack in the Box)

909510.title: Growing Up with Graphic Novels
909510.description: From dog-eared favorites to life-changing reads, graphic novels aren't just entertainment -- ;they're powerful tools for learning and connection. Authors and illustrators share the stories that shaped them -- and the ones they now create for today's young readers. Learn how these visual stories build literacy skills, foster empathy, and reflect the real challenges young readers face in and out of the classroom. Presented by the Children's Book Council
909510.people_list: Tony Weaver Jr, Red , Julio Anta, Gabriel Valenin, Andrew Weiner, Dan Yaccarino

910559.title: Spotlight on Hafsah Faizal - Post Panel Book Signing
910559.description: Join #1 New York Times and Indie-bestselling author Hafsah Faizal as meets fans and signs books after her spotlight panel. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.

909826.title: Comics Made Me Gay
909826.description:
A panel discussion with LGBTQ creators on the
comic books that helped shape them. A funny, bawdy, and often sweetly
emotional panel sharing the love of the medium with professionals and
fans alike. Moderated by Eisner winning author Marc Andreyko (“love is
love”, Manhunter, Torso, Batwoman). Panelists TBA.

911152.title: Blast-A-Trooper
911152.description: Interactive experience to “blast” Stormtroopers and Mandalorians with foam dart blasters; fundraiser for charity led by 501st ECG and Mandalorian Mercs Falco Clan.

896064.title: Let's Write the Names of Anime Characters in Japanese Calligraphy [Reservation Required]
896064.description: In this workshop, participants will write the names of various anime characters in Japanese calligraphy, following along as several characters are shown on the projector in a fun, quiz-style format. Reservations required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

909651.title: Marvel Fanfare with C.B. Cebulski
909651.description: It’s a meeting of two Marvel masters as Editor-in-Chief C.B. Cebulski has a candid chat with best-selling artist J. Scott Campbell about his "secret origin" and rise from fan to professional, the development of his iconic style, his new J.S.C. (Just Spectacular Collection) Variant Covers, and what’s next in his storied career at Marvel Comics! Plus, attendees will score an exclusive giveaway comic featuring gorgeous art from J. Scott Campbell himself!

904795.title: Mondo Toy Talk Live
904795.description:
Join Mondo’s creative team for an exclusive, behind-the-scenes look at their latest collectibles - and a few surprises along the way. Inspired by the fan-favorite YouTube livestream Mondo Toy Talk, this panel will be moderated by Bryan Starr (@bstarrcinema) and will feature Mondo’s Hector Arce (Senior Director, Creative and Product development), Peter Santa-Maria, a.k.a. AttackPeter (Senior Creative director), Cam Dean (Music Label Manager), and Nolan Fleming Smith (Senior Graphic Designer) as they pull back the curtain on the artistry, vision, and process behind Mondo’s most anticipated drops and exclusives.

Giveaways will be available for all panel attendees.

905845.title: Human Algorithm: Manga Recommendations for Educators & Librarians
905845.description: Interest in anime and manga has exploded over the last 5 years. Great for fans but it makes staying on top of what's popular and (more importantly) appropriate for libraries and schools difficult to discern. That's where the manga pros come in! Better than AI, join this panel of manga professionals that will act as your human algorithm to find manga perfect for your school, library and readers. We'll be taking questions all panel long to help build a list anyone can reference, completely powered by professional manga fans.

903874.title: Hollywood’s Next Wave: Finding New Franchises in a Sea of Content
903874.description: Hollywood is always on the hunt for its next big hit, and webcomics and webnovels are delivering in a big way! With fresh, diverse stories and built-in fanbases, WEBTOON Productions is changing the game—turning beloved digital stories into must-watch movies and shows. With a deep bench of content across WEBTOON’s global ecosystem, these stories are making the leap from page to production like never before. Get an inside look at how the next generation of films and TV shows are being shaped by the webcomics and webnovels fans can’t get enough of.

909511.title: Spotlight on Jim Butcher
909511.description: The beloved and bestselling author of the Dresden Files returns to NYCC to discuss his last work. To be followed by a book signing. Books available for sale at Barnes & Noble in Hall 1A.

909648.title: Prime Video’s Hazbin Hotel
909648.description: It’s almost time to check in for Season Two of Prime Video’s Hazbin Hotel, so join creator and executive producer Vivienne Medrano, and series stars Erika Henningsen, Blake Roman, Amir Talai, Kimiko Glenn, Alex Brightman, Jessica Vosk, Joel Perez, Lilli Cooper, Krystina Alabado and more for one helluva good panel filled with Season Two insights and breaking news that fans won’t want to miss. Trust Us.

903510.title: Creator-Owned Comics: Myths and Realities
903510.description: Owning your own work means controlling your own destiny, right? Well, it’s complicated. In this panel, veterans of self publishing, creator-owned titles, digital first, crowdfunded, corporate and licensed comics, and traditional book publishing discuss the pros and cons of different models, and how creators can mix and match strategies to build a career.

911091.title: Pop Cultr Marketing Summit Session Three: Anime
911091.description: Description: Learn how Anime has become a dominant cultural force while flying under traditional marketing's radar, and what other industries can learn from it.

911372.title: Growing Up with Graphic Novels - Post Panel Book Signing
911372.description: Join authors from the "Growing Up with Graphic Novels" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
911372.people_list: Red , Julio Anta, Gabriel Valenin, Tony Weaver Jr, Andrew Weiner, Dan Yaccarino

903505.title: Pop Culture Puppets!
903505.description: Some of pop culture's most colorful characters are brought to life by puppeteers - Yoda, Grogu, Gremlins, the Sesame Street puppets, the Muppets, the original live action Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, the aliens in Men In Black, Broadway's Avenue Q characters, the plants in Little Shop of Horrors, and many, many, more, including late night sketches on Saturday Night Live, The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, and Last Week Tonight With John Oliver. But like a magic show, the method behind a puppet performance is usually hidden, and the puppeteers unseen. Come meet puppeteers from some of your favorite TV, film, and theatre shows, and learn about what it takes to do their job, and create characters that light up pop culture! Panelists include Rick Lyon (Avenue Q, Late Show with Stephen Colbert, TMNT, Men In Black), Noel MacNeal (Bear in the Big Blue House, TMNT, Little Shop of Horrors, John Oliver), Jennifer Barnhart (Avenue Q, Sesame, Between the Lions, Helpsters, John Oliver), and Kathleen Kim (Sesame, SNL, Helpsters, Awkwafina is Nora From Queens).
903505.people_list: Richard Lyon, Kathleen Kim, Edward MacNeal, Jennifer Barnhart

909655.title: OverPower Rising: Bringing Skybound, Top Cow & Edgar Rice Burroughs to CCGs!
909655.description:
In 1995, Fleer launched OverPower to an intensely rabid fanbase, quickly creating a competitive community that spanned the world. Unlike most CCGs of its time, OverPower offered a distinctly different approach to strategy and structure. Though the game was discontinued at the height of its popularity in the late 2000s, pockets of players around the country kept it alive with local communities and regular tournaments. When Fleer finally abandoned its position, four players from across the country – businessmen who had met through tournaments and the online community – bonded together to purchase the company and reinvigorate the game. 

Today, they are currently producing new sets that include hot pop culture IPs like Skybound (e.g. The Walking Dead, Invincible), Top Cow (e.g. The Darkness, Witchblade, Cyberforce) and Edgar Rice Burroughs (e.g. Tarzan, John Carter), and utilizing the stellar artistry of comics superstars including Phillip Tan, Marc Silvestri, Joe Jusko, Jae Lee, Adam Kubert, Casey Parsons, Jon Lam, Ito and more. Come here the story of four self-proclaimed geeks – led by Lazarus Games Rising co-founders Ronald Pozzi & Joseph Gagnepain – who met through their love of a fanboy property, and have come together to revive and help the CCG thrive with big plans.

909421.title: Come Aboard the One Piece Meetup!
909421.description: Calling all pirates and marines alike for the One Piece cosplay meetup! There's always room for you if you want to meet new friends, take photos, and immerse yourself in the world of One Piece. Come join the crew at New York Comic Con!

909827.title: Murray Hill  Meet and Greet
909827.description: Murray Hill is a trailblazing NYC-based drag king and comedian who’s been serving old-school swagger and Borscht Belt banter since the '90s. Emerging from the downtown cabaret scene, Hill built his career on sharp suits, sharper jokes, and a persona that channels classic showbiz with a queer twist. Known as the “hardest-working middle-aged man in show business,” he’s brought drag king culture to the mainstream, most recently as the host of King of Drag, the first-ever drag king reality competition series.

911178.title: Jim Butcher Book Signing
911178.description: Jim Butcher, the bestselling and critically acclaimed author of the Dresden Files will be on hand to meet fans and sign books following the Spotlight on Jim Butcher panel. One book personalized, up to three total books signed. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble at the front of Hall 1A.

904415.title: Learn How to Draw Comics
904415.description: To attend this workshop - it is first come, first served. Limited space is available. Join Whilce Portacio (Uncanny X-Men, Punisher), Ryan Benjamin (Batman Beyond, Grifter), & Alex Sinclair (Batman, Justice League) for a hands-on drawing workshop focused on the process of creating comics. Don't forget to bring your sketchbooks and art materials to follow along with Comic Pro Boot Camp.

908820.title: ONI PRESS: THE LOUDEST THING THING IN COLOR
908820.description: For nearly 30 years, Oni Press has been publishing groundbreaking comics and graphic novels for readers of all ages. Now, coming off the heels of the publisher's most successful year of all time with the best-selling launches of EC COMICS, ADVENTURE TIME, BIKER MICE FROM MARS, and more, join President & Publisher Hunter Gorinson, Editor Karl Bollers, and a star-studded cast of Oni's upstart creators past, present, and future – including Rodney Barnes (Crownsville), Mat Heagerty (Indoor Kid), Matt Kindt (EC's Catacomb of Torment), George Northy (Yuletide), and Adam Syzm (Little Visitor & Other Abductions) – to look ahead at an action-packed slate of Oni's upcoming comics and graphic novels across the coming year!

911382.title: Panel Coming Soon
911382.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

909652.title: MARVEL COMICS: X-Men
909652.description: The Age of Revelation is here! Join VP & Executive Editors Nick Lowe and Tom Brevoort, along with Editor-in-Chief C.B. Cebulski and mighty mutant creators including Jed MacKay and Ryan Stegman as they share secrets behind the X-Men’s latest milestone … and what makes it one of the boldest futures in X-History! Plus, discover what lies ahead for mutantkind—including what emerges in Age of Revelation’s epic aftermath—with first looks, cover reveals, and more. Attendees who stay until the end can grab an exclusive giveaway comic book!

911766.title: Practicing Comic Book Law: Drafting Contracts That Bring Comics to Life [Separately Ticketed]
911766.description:
In this engaging CLE course, participants will tackle the essential agreements every comic book attorney needs to master. You’ll learn how to draft collaboration agreements, publishing deals, merchandising contracts, and film/TV licensing agreements—all under the guidance of experienced professionals. This interactive session emphasizes practical exercises, such as spotting legal issues, refining client negotiations, and drafting key contract provisions. Gain the tools and confidence to excel in the comic book publishing legal landscape. This session is approved for 2.0 CLE credits in professional practice for New York (both transitional and non-transitional).
Click here to learn more: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/industry/professionals/cle-opportunities.html

904353.title: Aniplex of America 20th Anniversary Industry Panel
904353.description: For the past 20 years, Aniplex of America has brought a wide variety of shows that have captured the hearts of many fans the world over! Join us as we celebrate our past, present, and future with a jam-packed anime industry anniversary panel!

909512.title: Where Fantasy Meets Romance
909512.description: Have you jumped on the romantasy train? Are you curious to know where fantasy meets romance? Join Erin A. Craig (A Land So Wide),  Alexandria Bellefleur (The Devil She Knows), Miranda Mundt (Muted: Volume 2), Purpah (Suitor Armor: Volume 3), and Emily Krempholtz (Violet Thistlewaite Is Not a Villain Anymore) as they discuss the nuances of wirting fantasy-romance vs. romantic fantasy, and why the marriage of these two genres resonates with so many readers.
909512.people_list: Erin A Craig, Alexandria Bellefleur, Emily Krempholtz, Purpah , Miranda Mundt

911593.title: RESERVATION REQUIRED -- George R.R. Martin Book Signing
911593.description: Join internationally bestselling author George R. R. Martin, best known for his series A Song of Ice and Fire, as he greets fans and signs books. In order for Mr. Martin to meet the largest number of fans, there is a limit of one book only per person with no personalization and no posed photos. PLEASE NOTE: A reservation is required for this event. Reservations will open on September 29. About NYCC reservations.

909817.title: Goldwork!  An introduction to Metal Thread Embroidery  [Separately Ticketed]
909817.description: Get started with your own goldwork project, learning the basics of metal thread embroidery and creating your own sample piece to take home!  This hands-on workshop from Cowbutt Crunchies serves as a beginner's introduction to the world of goldwork hand embroidery - no prior experience necessary.  Students will have the opportunity to get up close and personal with a variety of metal threads - learning where different materials might be applicable.   We will also step through the fundamentals of beginner-friendly goldwork, including using padding, pearl purl, and bright check chipwork. **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

896787.title: Capcom Presents
896787.description: A 90-minute panel showcasing all of Capcom's recent and upcoming releases.

909146.title: The Doughboys Comic: From Podcast to Page
909146.description: The podcast about chain restaurants is now a comic about... the same thing! But with toys and fight scenes! Join Mike Mitchell, Tiger Wiger, writer Alex Firer, artist Fred Stresing, and colorist Meg Casey as they dig into how The Doughboys became one of the weirdest, most collectible comics on the shelf. From behind-the-scene stories to exclusive previews, this panel has it all — including a Q&A, possible giveaways, and plenty of discussion about food, friendship, and figurines
909146.people_list: Michael Mitchell, Nicholas Wiger, Alex Firer, Fred Stresing, Meg Casey

903901.title: WAYNE BRADY: IMPROV NERDVANA (18+)
903901.description:
WHAT IS IT?

A mind-blowing, music-fueled improv experience starring Wayne Brady, blending the chaos of Comic-Con fandom with the genius of unscripted comedy. It’s part concert, part sketch show, part cosplay love letter—and 100% made up on the spot.

STARRING:

🎭 Wayne Brady – 5x Emmy Winner, 2x Grammy Nominee, author and the ultimate multi-class performer (bard + chaos sorcerer)

🎙️ Jonathan Mangum – Wayne’s longtime improv partner and comedy co-conspirator

🎸 Live Band – Spontaneous scoring, from sci-fi funk to fantasy metal

✨ Special Surprise Guests – You never know who might show up from the nerd galaxy

FORMAT:

    •    Audience-driven scenes & songs

    •    Nerd-fueled improv inspired by YOUR cosplay, fandoms, and stories

    •    Live musical numbers born from sci-fi, fantasy, anime, comics, and video games

    •    Cosplay cameos and fan shoutouts

    •    Hilarious (and heartfelt) nods to beloved nerd culture

    •    Zero script. Maximum chaos.

904195.title: The McFarlane Toys Multiverse
904195.description: Get an exclusive first look at the latest and greatest toys and collectibles from McFarlane Toys and Todd McFarlane himself! Explore exciting brands like DC Multiverse, Marvel, Spawn and so much more. Join the McFarlane Toys team, along with special guests, who will provide an in-depth look at these highly anticipated products. Plus, there will be some thrilling surprises and giveaways you won’t want to miss! Join us for an unforgettable event that promises to be a memorable experience for any collector.

909828.title: KINGS of the Con
909828.description:
It’s good to be king—and even better at Comic Con. Join us for a show-stopping panel celebrating the bold, the bearded, and the downright brilliant world of Drag Kings!

Hosted by the one and only Murray Hill—fresh off the groundbreaking first season of Drag Kings—this panel brings together a royal court of performers, from trailblazing legends to rising stars redefining the art of masculinity, parody, and performance.

Expect laughs, looks, and a whole lot of love for the often-overlooked kings of drag. Whether you're new to the scene or a longtime fan, come get schooled, entertained, and inspired by the fiercest gentlemen in the game.

Bow down. These Kings are here to slay.

911153.title: Jedi Meditation
911153.description: Calling all Younglings! Learn tips and techniques used by the Jedi Masters themselves, or take a few moments of calm in your busy day at NYCC. Hosted by Saber Guild’s Empire Temple.

909409.title: Final Fantasy Meetup
909409.description:
Across worlds and timelines, it’s time for all Warriors of Light to unite!
Whether you've been casting Firaga since the NES days, shed tears in Zanarkand, braved the Void with the Scions, or just really love chocobos and big swords — this is the ultimate gathering for fans of Final Fantasy.

Come dressed as your favorite Warrior of Light, villain, summon, raid boss, or moogle. From Ivalice to Eorzea, Midgar to Galbadia, and beyond — all are welcome to show off their glams, meet fellow fans and creators, and celebrate the series that defined generations of gaming.

Strike a pose, trade stickers, and share your love for everything from pixel classics to XVI's raw chaos. Whether you're rocking a 10/10 glam, a lovingly crafted cosplay, or a casual look straight out of the Gold Saucer, this meetup is your stage.

Let’s make it as legendary as the Lifestream — and yes, the sticker trade tradition lives on!
909409.people_list: Luis Combe, Aaron Scouten, Lijia Wang, Michelle Ross

911057.title: The Art Knight: Batman in Animation
911057.description: For over three decades, Warner Bros. Animation (WBA) has defined the animated legacy of the Dark Knight – from Batman: The Animated Series and Justice League to Batman: The Brave and the Bold, Batman: Caped Crusader, and countless DC animated films along the way. Join an all-star panel of WBA's top artists and creatives - featuring James Tucker (Executive Producer & Showrunner, Batman: Caped Crusader), Juan Meza-Leon (Director, Aztec Batman: Clash of Empires), Mike Roth (Executive Producer & Showrunner, Bat-Fam), and Simon J. Smith (Executive Producer, Batwheels) – for an in-depth look into the artistry, creative processes, and inspirations that fuel their bold new takes on one of the most iconic characters in comics and pop culture.
911057.people_list: James Tucker, Juan Meza Leon, Simon J. Smith, Mike Roth

903792.title: The Muppet Drawing Challenge, Presented by ToughPigs.com - The Unofficial Muppet Fan Site
903792.description:
Everyone loves Jim Henson's colorful creations from the Muppets, Sesame Street, and Fraggle Rock. But can our panel of expert artists draw them LIVE from memory?  And more importantly, can they make it funny?

Watch as talented illustrators take suggestions from the audience for obscure Muppet characters, silly mashups, bizarre scenarios and more, as they draw unique creations before your very eyes!

A perfect combination of the silliness of the Muppets with the artistry of Comic Con.

Presented by ToughPigs.com, the premiere Muppet fan site for over 20 years.
903792.people_list: Joseph Hennes, Jay Fosgitt, Chris Smigliano, Louis Henry Mitchell, Richard Michael Gomez, Dave Hulteen

909513.title: Five Dot Challenge: Illustrator Edition
909513.description: Six illustrators. Five random dots. Endless creativity. In this fast-paced, interactive showdown, audience members provide the dots—and the artists do the rest. Watch as each illustrator has just 30 seconds to turn a handful of dots into an original character, then build out a scene and spin a story on the spot. It’s part improv, part art battle, and 100% fun. Come for the creativity, stay for the chaos!
909513.people_list: Liz Montague, Trung Le Nguyen, Devin Elle Kurtz, Knack Whittle, Colleen AF Venable

910560.title: Where Fantasy Meets Romance - Post Panel Book Signing
910560.description: Join authors from the "Where Fantasy Meets Romance" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
910560.people_list: Purpah , Alexandria Bellefleur, Erin A Craig, Emily Krempholtz, Miranda Mundt

904762.title: FIGHT LIKE A MOTHER: Ronda Rousey on Fighting, Family, and Her Groundbreaking Graphic Novel with AWA
904762.description: UFC champion. WWE superstar. Now, best-selling author, screenwriter, and comic book creator. Join Ronda Rousey as she dives into the creation of her debut graphic novel, EXPECTING THE UNEXPECTED, an unflinching thriller about survival and fierce motherhood. In conversation with a special moderator (TBA), Ronda will reveal how her own pregnancy, fears, and personal growth helped shape this raw, high-stakes story. Fans will get an exclusive look behind the scenes, from her first script pages to how Ronda collaborated with legendary comic book artist Mike Deodato to turn her words and fight scenes into these unforgettable pages with AWA.

909483.title: Panel Coming Soon
909483.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

909514.title: Spotlight on Lauren Roberts
909514.description: New York Times bestselling author Lauren Roberts (Powerless series) sits down with TikToker Ayman to talk romance, rebellion, and royalty in her blockbuster romantasy series. Hear how she built her unforgettable world, created swoon-worthy banter, and became one of the genre’s hottest new voices.

909806.title: Making a Cosplay Prop with Masked Dad Workshop [Reservation Required]
909806.description: Learn to build a cosplay prop with Masked Dad Workshop, a cosplay supply company founded by two dads of color in NYC. This hands-on workshop will teach you essential tips and tricks to get started, and give you the chance to ask questions in person with experienced, award-winning cosplayers. **A reservation Is required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

904784.title: TMNT: What’s Next for the Heroes in a Half Shell?
904784.description: New York is TMNT’s home turf, so we’re spilling all of the secrets behind IDW’s best-selling and acclaimed line of Ninja Turtles comics! From the new run with Gene Luen Yang and Freddie Williams II to the fan-favorite event Battle Nexus, this panel’s surprises and reveals will make fans want to yell “cowabunga!”

909415.title: Pokémon Gotta Meet Em All
909415.description: From Pokémon Go to Pokemon TCG to the Pokemon video games. Welcome all trainers to a meet up where you can meet new trainers, trade, battle and have a good time!
909415.people_list: Kristiana Marcopoulos, Taylor Fueg, Juhi Aggarwal

904407.title: Exquisite Corpses: The Game (Live play and panel)
904407.description: The horror event of the year is coming to a game store near you! Join James Tynion IV, Michael Walsh, and the Corpse Crew as they run the first public game of Exquisite Corpses: The Game! Followed by a panel and Q+A with giveaways! Be ready to rep your favorite killer!

904214.title: Introduction to Ita Bags - Design a Spooky Pin
904214.description: To attend this workshop - it is first come, first served. Limited space is available. Ever wonder what those cute bags covered in pins and charms are all about? Welcome to the world of ita bags - the ultimate way to show love for your favorite characters, series, or aesthetics! In this beginner-friendly workshop, we’ll explore the history and evolution of ita bags, from their origins in Japanese fan culture to the creative expressions seen today. Then, it's your turn! Guests will receive a design sheet to create their own spooky-themed pin concept and get tips on building an ita bag. Whether you're a casual fan or a crafting queen, come design, doodle, and get inspired to start your very own ita bag journey!
904214.people_list: The Cast of Milk Pink Maid Cafe
people: The Cast of Milk Pink Maid Cafe

909646.title: Probably the Best Invincible Panel in the History of Invincible Panels
909646.description: Join Emmy-Award winner Steven Yeun, Gillian Jacobs, co-creator, co-showrunner, executive producer Robert Kirkman, and members of the star-studded voice cast for exclusive conversation filled with Season Four teases, behind-the-scenes insights, and surprises Invincible fans won’t want to miss. Has Invincible recovered from the fight with Conquest? Will things ever be the same with Eve? Will there be more Omni-Man in Season Four? Where is Season Five, William? All questions that may or may not be answered!

909515.title: Celebrity Author Trivia
909515.description: Watch three acclaimed and bestselling writers -- Jim Butcher, Joe Hill, Maggie Stiefvater -- duke out in a literary-themed game of trivia. Be sure to frame your answer in the form of a question!  Hosted by bestselling author, Tessa Bailey!
909515.people_list: Jim Butcher, Maggie Stiefvater, Tessa Bailey, Joe Hill

911180.title: Five Dot Challenge - Post Panel Book Signing
911180.description: Join authors from the "Five Dot Challenge" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
911180.people_list: Devin Elle Kurtz, Liz Montague, Trung Le Nguyen, Colleen AF Venable, Knack Whittle

904386.title: Let's Play Returns!
904386.description: Leeanne M. Krecic's global phenomenon Let's Play is back! Season 4 is launching exclusively on [REDACTED] next month alongside the premiere of the Let's Play anime series from legendary studio OLM (Pokémon, Komi Can't Communicate) on streaming giant Crunchyroll! Fans attending the panel will get an exclusive first look at both the season 4 Webtoon and a clip from the anime series along with some never before seen behind the scenes production art. Additionally, we'll have a first look at the Let's Play tabletop game also launching in October from Rocketship Entertainment, publisher of the series.

911729.title: RESERVATION REQUIRED - Lauren Roberts Book Signing
911729.description: New York Times bestselling author Lauren Roberts (Powerless series) will greet fans and sign books. This signing requires a separate reservation. We will scan your QR code to admit you to the signing line. One book personalized, up to three books signed, no posed photos. Books will be available for purchase at the Barnes & Noble booth adjacent to the signing tables.

897749.title: You BOT This:Library/High School Robotics Partnerships
897749.description:
Looking for a way to incorporate STEAM and robotics into your children’s programming? Want to work on community partnerships? 

Join Molly Virello, Head of Children’s Services, and Stacey Hilton, advisor of SHS Robotics Club the Southington Cyber Knights, as they discuss how to partner with your local high school’s robotics team to bring dynamic robotics themed programming to your library!

903431.title: Body Paint and SFX 101: Its not as scary as it looks
903431.description: Curious about body paint or special effects makeup but don’t know where to start? Whether you're planning a full creature cosplay, bringing a colorful character to life, or just want to dabble in the spooky and strange, this beginner-friendly panel breaks down the basics of body paint and SFX. We'll cover essential tools, safe products, application tips, and tricks to avoid common pitfalls. Learn how to work with latex, face paints, prosthetics, and more—without breaking the bank or losing your mind. Perfect for cosplayers, Halloween lovers, and makeup geeks alike! Hosted by a fellow fan who's been there, glued that.

909575.title: Jim Lee & Friends
909575.description: At this year’s New York Comic Con, DC President, Publisher and Chief Creative Officer Jim Lee will treat fans to a powerful lineup of surprise announcements, reveals and special guests, along with great conversations with top comic creators, during DC’s annual NYCC “Jim Lee & Friends” panel. Moderated by Jim Lee

909654.title: Marvel Multiverse Role-Playing Game LIVE!
909654.description: Join the Marvel Multiverse alongside Mighty Marvel Guests as they smash, clobber, and thwip their way through an exciting and hilarious live-play adventure that you won't want to miss.

909680.title: GKIDS Presents: ALL YOU NEED IS KILL U.S. Premiere
909680.description:
Following an alien plant invasion, Rita is caught in the destruction—and killed. But then she wakes up again. And again. Caught in an endless time loop, Rita must navigate the trauma and repetition of death until she crosses paths with Keiji, a shy young man trapped in the same cycle. Together, they fight to break free from the loop and find meaning in the chaos around them.

Experience the showstopping U.S. premiere of the action sci-fi film ALL YOU NEED IS KILL, based on the globally beloved novel of the same name by Hiroshi Sakurazaka, with animation brought to life by STUDIO4℃. All guests will receive an exclusive print for this special screening.

909429.title: Gotham's Finest Cosplayers Meetup and Photoshoot
909429.description:
Step into the shadows as some of Gotham‘s most iconic heroes and villains as the DC Cosplayers East presents Gotham’s Finest Cosplay Meetup and Photoshoot where the dark streets come ALIVE! Whether you cosplay Gotham’s protectors (Batman, Robin, Batgirl etc… or Gotham’s most sinister (Joker, Bane, Two-Face etc…) please join us Friday October 10th at 630PM in the North Tower. Check out our event page on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/events/1200077225218067


In addition you can join us for our classic DC Universe cosplay meetup which all heroes and villains of the DC world are welcome and will take place Friday October 10th at 2PM by the staircase on the first floor at the special events hall. You can check out that event page on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/events/828221356152319
909429.people_list: Carlos Smith, Robert Burdi, Sophia Elwell, Angelo Maione, Michael Gilbert, Izabelle Garcia, Taylor Van Ackem

909516.title: Water, Earth, Fire, Air: Continuing the Avatar Legacy Panel
909516.description: Abrams Books, Dark Horse Comics, WEBTOON, and Magpie Games are thrilled to treat fans to a panel worthy of the Avatar! Join publishing's creators and writers of Avatar: The Last Airbender and The Legend of Korra for an exploration of the beloved world.

909818.title: Let's Learn UV Resin: Create your Own Resin Jewelry and Gems  [Separately Ticketed]
909818.description: Dive into the world of resin with Cowbutt Crunchies in this beginner's intro course.  We'll learn the basics of how resin works, safety protocols, as well as the difference between various UV and Epoxy resins.  Students will be able to put their skills to the test as they create their own resin pendants and gemstones, using their choice of flowers, leaves, color tints, sparkles, or even spooky mix-ins! **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

904217.title: Comixology and Kindle Colorsoft Present: The Art of Color
904217.description: Join whimsical celebrity baker, cookbook author, and graphic novelist Kim-Joy (Turtle Bread) in conversation with legendary Eisner Award-nominated comic book colorist Lee Loughridge (Deadly Class, Fables, Midstate and many more) as they discuss the art of color—from the process of choosing the color palette to convey time, mood, feeling and setting, to getting it on the page or, in some instances, the dessert.

909649.title: Anne Rice's Immortal Universe (AMC/AMC+)
909649.description: AMC and AMC+ present panels featuring the casts and executive producers from two series within  Anne Rice's Immortal Universe, including the highly anticipated new series Anne Rice’s Talamasca: The Secret Order, focused on the secretive society responsible for tracking and containing the witches, vampires, and other creatures around the globe, ahead of its October 26 premiere on AMC and AMC+, and the new rock-and-roll season of Anne Rice’s The Vampire Lestat, which follows rockstar Lestat and his band on tour and returns in 2026.

909517.title: MrBallen Presents: Where Nightmares Live
909517.description: Join MrBallen - the bestselling author, founder of Ballen Studios, and the creator and host of the popular true crime podcast, MrBallen Podcast: Strange, Dark & Mysterious Stories - as he shares stories from his newest graphic novel 'MrBallen Presents: Where Nightmares Live'.  From skin-melting encounters in Brazil to a bus full of malevolent ghosts in Taipei, to a bell ringing deep in the Arizona wilderness, MrBallen's spine-chilling tales span multiple centuries and expose bizarre, terrifying, and utterly unforgettable experiences of the unnatural world. Audience Q+A to follow.

897790.title: Salaam Fandom! Muslim Gamers, Creators, and Cosplayers
897790.description: Join us for a conversation about pop culture and the many intersections with Islam. Come meet Muslim scholars, comics creators, writers, gamers, and cosplayers! Moderated by comics editor, writer, and scholar Dr. Shamika Mitchell (State University of New York, Rockland Community College/Women in Comics).
897790.people_list: Shamika Mitchell, Rasheed Chappell, George Spivey, Laylah Abdullah-Poulos, Mazi Oyo

903647.title: Spooky Paint & Sip [Reservation Required]
903647.description:
Unleash your inner ghoul and get your brushes ready—Kage Kickback is bringing a spine-tingling twist to our signature anime-inspired paint & sip experience at NYCC! This session is your chance to create eerie-sistible art inspired by your favorite supernatural, spooky, and villainous characters.
Reservations required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

897278.title: Puppetry in Film: Meet the Puppeteers Bringing Your Favorite Characters to Life
897278.description: From galaxies far, far, away to adventures under the sea, puppetry is a crucial storytelling tool for filmmakers. In this interactive panel, meet the puppeteers who bring beloved film characters to life, and learn what it's like to design, build, and manipulate puppets for film! Bringing your own puppet is not required, but highly recommended for maximum fun!
897278.people_list: Peter Charney, Phillip Huber, James Ortiz, Jon Riddleberger, Julia Schemmer

909417.title: Resident Evil Cosplay Meetup
909417.description: S.T.A.R.S. Assemble! Whether you’re a Raccoon City survivor, Umbrella operative, or one of the iconic bio-weapons, this is your chance to bring the world of Resident Evil to life. Join fellow fans for a cosplay gathering filled with photo ops, character interactions, and undead energy! All versions from the games, films, and remakes are welcome.

909647.title: BlumFest 2025
909647.description: Blumhouse returns to the Javits Center for an explosive third year with BlumFest 2025 at New York Comic Con! The company will showcase its terrifying upcoming projects for this year plus an electrifying sneak peek at what’s upcoming for 2026.

909214.title: Stitch & Mix After Dark: Crochet 101 [Reservation Required]
909214.description: Beginner or experienced, with our team, you'll learn how to make the cutest accessory in this event! We'll provide the tools and steps necessary, all you have to do is bring yourself! ‘With one knot at a time you’ll be able to pick up a new hobby and something cool to show off. Come join us and let's get knotty! Reservations required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

909518.title: NYCC Poetry Slam
909518.description: Join us for the 2nd Annual New York Comic Con Poetry Slam! Poetry can’t really be appreciated until its experienced live. Come share your poem of three minutes or less, or come to hear others read. The sign-up board will open fifteen minutes before the scheduled start of the event. Poets will be accepted on a first-come, first-served basis. The audience will select the best poem of the evening, and the winner will receive a $50 gift card to Barnes & Noble Union Square.  Hosted by local poet, Jive Poetic.

909519.title: Fierce Reads for Fall: Fill Your Bookshelves with these YA Must-Reads
909519.description: From falling in love to switching bodies with your crush, second-chance-romances to romantic fantasies, discover your next favorite read in this powerhouse Fierce Reads for Fall panel featuring some of the biggest voices in YA. Hafsah Faizal (A Steeping of Blood), Ngozi Ukazu (Flip), Owena White and Suzana Harcum (Tripping Over You Volume 1), and Page Powars (And They Were Roommates) discuss their newest and most anticipated books. Moderated by Aurora Dominguez.
909519.people_list: Aurora Dominguez, Hafsah Faizal, Ngozi Ukazu, Owena White, Page Powars, Suzana Harcum

904403.title: Cyanide & Happiness: Stuff We Shouldn't Show
904403.description: Meet the minds behind Cyanide & Happiness and find out what makes them tick. Watch some early exclusive and never-before-seen C&H animations that we probably shouldn't show, followed by a QA session.

909812.title: Comics and Hip-Hop: A Marvel x Mass Appeal Conversation
909812.description: Marvel and Mass Appeal discuss the cultural power of comics and hip-hop.

909837.title: Heroes, Villains, Spaces In-Between: Pro Wrestling and Comic Storytelling
909837.description: With an audience as vocal and passionate as those in the world of comics and animation, All Elite Wrestling has developed their own pantheon of heroes and rogue gallery of villains that would rival any bagged and boarded collection. Join us as we look at where the worlds of wrestling and comics converge within AEW and how heroes and villains can be drawn not just pen and ink, but blood, sweat, and tears.

909650.title: The Walking Dead: Daryl Dixon (AMC/AMC+)
909650.description: Ahead of season three’s final two episodes, the cast and executive producers discuss the remainder of the season, which tracks Carol and Daryl as they continue their journey towards home and the ones they love, and share exclusive new footage from the show.

904022.title: The Voices of Ash Ketchum & Professor Oak BATTLE with "BALLS: The Monster-Catchin' Comédy"
904022.description:
This exclusive Comic Con performance and panel reunites Veronica Taylor and Stuart Zagnit (the original voices of Ash Ketchum and Professor Oak from "Pokémon: The Series") for a Q&A with the cast of "BALLS: The Monster-Catchin' Musical Comédy". Plus live musical performances and an interactive, RPG-battle between the audience and our scrappy squad of monster puppets.

“BALLS” is an action-packed, immersive, Off-Broadway show, now starring Stuart Zagnit, the original voice of Professor Oak from "Pokémon".

Giveaways include free T-Shirts, Hats, Trading Cards, Tickets to the Show, and Ponchos for the SPLASH ZONE. (Everyone gets a prize!)
904022.people_list: Kathleen McInerney, Rachel Parker, Brandon Zelman, Harrison Bryan, Stuart Zagnit, Teresa Attridge

910189.title: Gotham Comedy Live at NYCC
910189.description: Gotham Comedy Club has partnered with NYCC to bring you a Friday night of iconic stand-up comedy live at the Javits Center. Join us for a lineup featuring some of the best comedians the city has to offer. Whether it’s absurd, observational or anything in between it will be a night to remember because it’s curated by the premier comedy club in the city.

907937.title: NYCC After Dark Karaoke
907937.description:
After a thrilling day at New York Comic Con, unleash your inner rockstar at the After Dark Karaoke! Step onto the stage, pick your favorite song, and belt it out alongside friends. 

After Dark Karaoke isn't just a night out, it's your moment to be legendary. 🎶

903428.title: Guts, Gore, and Guerrilla Filmmaking with Troma Entertainment & Annum Films (18+)
903428.description:
Dive deep into the wild world of guerrilla filmmaking with Guts, Gore, and Guerrilla Filmmaking with Troma Entertainment & Annum Films (18+). Join the creators behind the award-winning, cult indie horror anthology Bring on the Damned! as they go behind the blood and reveal how they crafted a visceral, unrelenting horror experience on a shoestring budget of just $20,000.

This panel offers an unfiltered look at the chaos, creativity, and sheer determination it takes to produce gritty, boundary-pushing cinema outside the Hollywood system. From DIY practical effects and guerrilla shooting tactics to navigating the digital and Blu-ray release landscape, hear firsthand stories of passion and perseverance from Troma legend Lloyd Kaufman and the talented filmmakers from Troma Entertainment & Annum Films.

Expect behind-the-scenes insights, exclusive previews of upcoming features and shorts, and a sneak peek at unique collectibles like potential vinyl soundtracks and VHS releases. Plus, get ready for giveaways and audience Q&A as we celebrate the future of indie horror and the raw power of true DIY filmmaking.

909422.title: Helluva Hangout: A Hellaverse Meetup
909422.description: Calling all imps and overlords — it’s time to strut your stuff straight outta Hell! Join fellow fans of Helluva Boss for a devilishly fun cosplay meetup where chaos, creativity, and camaraderie reign supreme. Whether you’re rocking a full Stolas ensemble or just here to appreciate the hellishly good looks, this is the place to show off your style and passion.

909595.title: The New York Comic Con Talent Show!
909595.description:
We are proudly welcoming back The New York Comic Con Talent Show, a dazzling display of creativity, skill, and entertainment, starring your fellow con-goers! Come on by and support your local performers as they showcase their unique talents, whether they be singing, dancing, juggling, playing an instrument, magic, comedy, or any other extraordinary ability, for a chance to win some fabulous prizes (and bragging rights)! 
**Please note you must sign up in advance to participate as a performer in the Talent show! We will be opening sign-ups this coming Wednesday August 20, 2025.

909829.title: Queering the Con: LGBTQ+ Cosplay Takes Center Stage
909829.description:
Ready for some next-level cosplay?
Watch as drag and fandom collide in the fiercest way possible! Hosted by RuPaul’s Drag Race favorite Megami, this panel unites queens who transform cosplay into high art—and high drama.

Get the inside scoop as fan favorites spill secrets, serve jaw-dropping looks, and blend comic book fantasy with the fabulous world of drag. Stick around after for merch, photo ops, and all the sparkle you can handle.

Whether you’re here for the wigs, the wonder, or the wigs and wonder—this is one Comic Con event you won’t want to miss.

909630.title: Copyrights and Contracts for Comic Book Creators
909630.description: To attend this workshop - it is first come, first served. Limited space is available. Step into the legal trenches of comic book creation with this fast-paced, one-hour workshop designed for creators, publishers, and dealmakers. We’ll crack open the vault on copyright essentials, decode the fine print of contracts, and tackle the wild frontier of AI-generated content. This year’s spotlight: how artificial intelligence is reshaping rights, royalties, and creative control. Plus, we’ll arm you with savvy negotiation tactics to survive—and thrive—in today’s volatile publishing economy. Celebrate our 20th year at NYCC with Thomas Crowell, Esq., author of The Pocket Lawyer for Comic Book Creators, and entertainment and labor lawyer Sheafe Walker, Esq., along with a few surprise guests. Don’t miss this opportunity to gain valuable knowledge while having fun!

909656.title: HBO’s IT: WELCOME TO DERRY: Never-Before-Seen Clips and Conversation with Cast and Creatives
909656.description: Join cast and creatives for an exclusive look at never-before-seen footage from HBO’s upcoming series IT: WELCOME TO DERRY, from Warner Bros. Television. Panelists include: Andy Muschietti (Director, EP), Barbara Muschietti (EP), Jason Fuchs (Co-Showrunner, EP), Brad Caleb Kane (Co-Showrunner, EP), Taylour Paige, Jovan Adepo, Chris Chalk, James Remar, Kimberly Guerrero, and Stephen Rider.
909656.people_list: Barbara and Andy Muschietti, Brad Caleb Kane, Chris Chalk, James Remar, Jason Fuchs, Jovan Adepo, Stephen Rider, Taylour Paige, Kimberly Guerrero

909669.title: Mala: Indian Mysticism Permeate the Core of Psychological Thriller
909669.description: Reema unexpectedly inherits an abandoned resort on a remote tropical island and, accompanied by trio of her friends, sets out to uncover the truth behind her inheritance. Upon arrival, the group encounters enigmatic locals, peculiar rituals and sinister omens, leading Reema to suspect her aunt's untimely death was anything but accidental. As Reema delves into the island’s secrets, she discovers that her family’s past is intertwined with an ancient curse involving tantric rituals and forbidden practices. Haunted by visions and cryptic messages from her late mother, Reema must navigate a labyrinth of spiritual awakening, familial betrayal and moral dilemmas to emerge and morph into her true self. As tensions rise and the rituals grow perilous, Reema and her friends must confront their deepest fears to survive the island’s sinister grip. A psychological thriller steeped in Indian mysticism and dark magic, Mala will be discussed by a panel of cast members – led by Indigo Sabharwal (Curry Scent) as the title character, alongside Raw Leiba (The Walking Dead), Nehru Sabharwal, and Nikhil Kamkolkar (Love, Love) – and filmmakers, including Nisha Sabharwal (Draupadi Unleashed), a multifaceted creative professional known for her work as an author, screenwriter, co-director and producer; and budding director Trishul Thejasvi (Greater Lakeland).

909423.title: Romantasy, BookTok, Worldhoppers & Beyond - The Ultimate Book Meetup
909423.description: Calling all book fans from the Night Court to Luthadel! Whether you're diving in the Cosmere, swooning over fae royalty, or swapping spicy takes on BookTok, this meetup is the place for you. Join fellow readers and creators for rec swaps, character gushing, and cozy vibes. Cosplay is welcome, hot takes are encouraged, and fun is guaranteed - because there's always another secret and another book bestie to meet.
909423.people_list: Megan Kaczanowski, Tina Byer, Juhi Aggarwal

909710.title: Playbill presents: DEATH BECOMES HER on Broadway
909710.description:
The Tony Award®-Winning Musical

Madeline Ashton is the most beautiful actress (just ask her) ever to grace the stage and screen. Helen Sharp is the long-suffering author (just ask her) who lives in her shadow. They have always been the best of frenemies…until Madeline steals Helen’s fiancé away. As Helen plots revenge and Madeline clings to her rapidly fading star, their world is suddenly turned upside down by Viola Van Horn, a mysterious woman with a secret that’s to die for.

After one sip of Viola’s magical potion, Madeline and Helen begin a new era of life (and death) with their youth and beauty restored…and a grudge to last eternity.

Now a warning! You may not be ready for the unbelievable amount of comedy, glamour, and magic onstage at the Lunt-Fontanne Theatre. Death Becomes Her is a “wildly entertaining, perfect musical comedy. It grabs the audience by the jugular and doesn’t let go” (Deadline). Starring Tony nominees Megan Hilty, Jennifer Simard, and Christopher Sieber, plus Grammy® winner Michelle Williams, with direction and choreography by Tony winner Christopher Gattelli, Death Becomes Her is “a laugh-filled, tuneful musical to die for” (Variety) and “a cheek-aching laughter roller coaster — the most fun night out on Broadway!” (The Daily Beast). Experience the “savagely funny” (Time Out) pop-culture phenomenon that’s been certified “hilarious” by The New York Times, Entertainment Weekly, Z100, Beyoncé (!!), Goldie Hawn, Superman aka David Corenswet, Michelle Williams (the other one), and countless fans on Instagram, TikTok, and beyond. See it now, and laugh for eternity.

909819.title: Organics, Textures, and Detailing: The Art of Foamwork  [Separately Ticketed]
909819.description: Hungry to give your armor and foamwork projects a more detailed flare?  Texturizing is a fantastic way to breathe life into flat foam, and this class from Cowbutt Crunchies will touch on numerous different ways to approach adding texture for a more complex look.  Students will have the chance to create various eva foam samples to take home as they try out woodburning tools, glues, and stamps, followed by a more organic approach using foam clay. **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

909564.title: Spotlight on George R. R. Martin
909564.description: Join internationally bestselling author George R. R. Martin, best known for his series A Song of Ice and Fire, as he discusses storytelling across mediums, including his experiences adapting stories and promoting production in New Mexico.

909565.title: Summon New Elder Gods
909565.description: Join celebrated authors James D'Amato, Jef Aldrich, and Jon Taylor as they use the Ultimate RPG Worldbuilding Guide to create new horrors from beyond space and time. Audience participation will be enforced both to create and summon these entirely fictional and mostly original entities into one of the halls of the Javits Center.
909565.people_list: Jef Aldrich, James D'Amato, Jon Taylor

909732.title: Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.: A Reunion with Clark Gregg, Ming-Na Wen & Chloe Bennet
909732.description: Your favorite agents have returned to NYCC —this time for a special cast reunion with the stars who helped turn a one-shot revival into seven seasons of unforgettable storytelling. Join Clark Gregg (Agent Phil Coulson), Ming-Na Wen (Agent Melinda May), and Chloe Bennet (Daisy Johnson/Quake) as they reflect on the show's lasting legacy, share behind-the-scenes stories, and celebrate the passionate fan community that kept the S.H.I.E.L.D. mission alive. From “Coulson Lives!” to the rise of Quake and the saga of time-hopping agents and LMDs, this is the ultimate reunion for anyone who rode the bus from day one.
909732.people_list: Clark Gregg, Ming-Na Wen, Chloe Bennet, Ashley V Robinson

909566.title: A Deep Dive into Art by Peter McCarty
909566.description: Beloved picture book author and Caldecott Honor recipient Peter McCarty breaks new ground with his latest book, THE FIVE WOLVES. This interactive program will take you from his inspiration to a close look into his signature cross-hatch art style. This is not one to miss!

909570.title: Kickstarter 101
909570.description: Join Kickstarter's Head of Publishing, Oriana Leckert, for a look at the tips, tricks, and strategies behind successful literary crowdfunding campaigns. You'll learn about the benefits of building community and raising money through crowdfunding, the publishing landscape on Kickstarter, and the most important elements of building and running a project, illustrated with case studies from authors and publishers across the literary spectrum.

911177.title: Jim Butcher Book Signing
911177.description: Jim Butcher, the bestselling and critically acclaimed author of the Dresden Files will be on hand to meet fans and sign books. One book personalized, up to three total books signed. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble at the front of Hall 1A.

909033.title: Todd McFarlane and J. Scott Campbell: Legends in Conversation
909033.description: Two industry titans take the stage together for the first time ever at NYCC! Legendary creators and comics pioneers Todd McFarlane and J. Scott Campbell join forces to share insights on their storied careers, creative journeys and the evolution of the comic book medium. Plus behind-the-scenes anecdotes about the making of some of their most popular and iconic works. Whether you’re a seasoned fan or new to the world of comics, this rare glimpse into the minds of these creators is a must-attend!

909571.title: Spotlight on Matt Dinniman
909571.description: New York Comic Con is excited to welcome Matt Dinniman, the acclaimed and bestselling author of the Dungeon Crawler Carl books, to our literary program. Matt will discuss his latest work and what life is like as a writer,

909830.title: Cosplay and RuPaul Merch Sales
909830.description: What better way to follow up a panel than having a chance to get photos and Merch!

911377.title: Summon New Elder Gods - Post Panel Signing
911377.description: Join authors from the "Summon New Elder Gods" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
911377.people_list: Jef Aldrich, James D'Amato, Jon Taylor

911154.title: Jedi Meditation
911154.description: Calling all Younglings! Learn tips and techniques used by the Jedi Masters themselves, or take a few moments of calm in your busy day at NYCC. Hosted by Saber Guild’s Empire Temple.

905844.title: How to Start Building a Manga Collection for your School or Library
905844.description: Are you an educator or librarian struggling to know which manga is right for your readers? Let manga professionals help! Join this panel of publishing professionals, and professional fans for a conversation that offers tips on how to get stared, popular recommendations, resources to help make informed decisions, giveaways and more! We're here to help start or grow your manga library!

909576.title: DC K.O.: What’s Next
909576.description: Join top DC storytellers in a next level NYCC panel that dives deeper into DC’s All In publishing initiative—including DC K.O., Knightfight, DC’s Absolute comic books, and beyond! Moderated by DC Group Editor Paul Kaminski and DC Group Editor Rob Levin

909432.title: X-Men Meetup
909432.description:
With the continuing excitement around the X-Men franchise, from Hellfire Gala to Marvel Rivals to X-Men ‘97 and beyond, come join X-Men cosplayers and fans for a meetup to celebrate all things X-Men!

Check out the Facebook Page: https://m.facebook.com/events/javits-convention-center-nyc/x-men-meetup-at-nycc-2025/972550808281939/
909432.people_list: Lisa Giunta-Popeil, Lyndsey Petrofsky, Mark Lugo, Stefanie Candelario

909718.title: Game On! The Videogame Gameshow
909718.description: Join YouTube content creator, and Twitch streamer AbdallahSmash as he hosts this high-energy interactive gameshow where contestants battle in trivia and gameplay challenges. Audience members can jump on stage for their chance to win prizes and show off their skills in a fun, family-friendly competition.

904122.title: Image Comics Presents - Brian K. Vaughan & Niko Henrichon LIVE!
904122.description: Join us for an in-depth conversation with master storyteller Brian K Vaughan as he shares details about his new OGN, Spectators, as well as upcoming revelations in SAGA and even more.

910563.title: A Deep Dive into Art by Peter McCarty - Post Panel Book Signing
910563.description: Join beloved picture book author and Caldecott Honor recipient Peter McCarty as he meets fans and signs books following his panel. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.

909664.title: BAT-FAM SNEAK PEEK SCREENING AND Q&A
909664.description: Warner Bros. Animation and Prime Video are shining the Bat Signal for all ages with an exclusive sneak peek of your next favorite Batman series, BAT-FAM. Join executive producer and showrunner Mike Roth alongside surprise cast members for an in-depth look at this next animated iteration of the Caped Crusader, and be the first to preview an episode of the new series. BAT-FAM follows the events of the hit film, MERRY LITTLE BATMAN, focusing on Batman, Alfred, and young Damian Wayne—who has now taken on the mantle of Little Batman—alongside a few newcomers to Wayne Manor, as they navigate the fun and frustrations of life as a super family. You won’t want to miss it!

905853.title: LEGO Workshop by 8 Bit Bricks
905853.description: To attend this workshop - it is first come, first served. Limited space is available. In this hands-on workshop, attendees will build an exclusive LEGO creation designed to commemorate NYCC. Participants will receive all the necessary bricks and step-by-step guidance to assemble a predetermined pop culture character -ranging from iconic video game heroes to beloved comic book figures - while also gaining insight into the creative design process behind it.
905853.people_list: Jonathan Lazar, Melissa Silvestri, Brian Gaudreault, Jason Rittberg

903900.title: BOOM! Studios - 20 Years, Here's To The Future!
903900.description: Since its founding in 2005, BOOM! Studios has been an industry leader in character driven, high concept stories across age ranges, genres, and creator-owned and licensed stories.  Discover yours as we announce bold, exciting new stories, new creators, and updates on your favorite comics & books!  Please join us as we celebrate the character and creators we’ve come to know and love from the past 20 years, and as we look ahead at what the next 20 years has in store!

909807.title: Making a Cosplay Prop with Masked Dad Workshop [Reservation Required]
909807.description: Learn to build a cosplay prop with Masked Dad Workshop, a cosplay supply company founded by two dads of color in NYC. This hands-on workshop will teach you essential tips and tricks to get started, and give you the chance to ask questions in person with experienced, award-winning cosplayers. **A reservation Is required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

904770.title: Bad Egg Presents: LaurenZside's Going Under
904770.description: Spend an hour with YouTube Megastar LAURENZSIDE as we explore the creation of her brand new original graphic novel GOING UNDER. Get a behind the scenes look at the creation of Going Under, from concept to script to final art. Featuring LaurenZside, H.E. Caldwell, Kelley Skovron, and from Bad Egg, Robert Meyers.
904770.people_list: Kelley Skovron, Hilaree Caldwell, Robert Meyers, Lauren Weber

909578.title: Embodying Evil: Creating Villain Characters for Young Adult Fiction
909578.description: The best villain characters might crackle with green lightening or transform into 20-foot cryptids… or they might dox you on TikTok when you start dating their ex-boyfriend. In this workshop led by YA thriller author and creative writing nonprofit founder Rowana Miller, participants will dissect what makes a villain resonate with teen readers and design their own original characters that embody the principles of YA darkness.

896651.title: The George Lucas Talk Show
896651.description: The George Lucas Talk Show is an improvised talk show in New York City hosted by comedian Connor Ratliff (Dead Eyes, Marvelous Mrs. Maisel), who appears as George Lucas, the creator of Star Wars, and he interviews real guests as themselves in a panel format. He is joined by sidekick Watto, played by Griffin Newman (Blank Check, The Tick), and show producer Patrick Cotnoir (Star Wars Live Reads, The Chris Gethard Show, Marvel). The show ran for over 6 years at the UCB Theater in New York and has had guests like Whoopi Goldberg, Jon Hamm, Seth Rogen, Jack Quaid, Tawny Newsome, Rachel Zegler, Kevin Smith, Nicole Byer, Sonia Manzano, Ira Glass, Lea Thompson, Ben Schwartz, Peter Serafinowicz, Ahmed Best, Tony Hale, David K. Harbour, D’Arcy Carden, Solo writer Jon Kasdan, Rogue One writers Chris Weitz and Gary Whitta, Meredith Vieira, and musicians like Aimee Mann.
896651.people_list: Patrick Cotnoir, Connor Ratliff, Griffin Newman, Zach Cherry

911618.title: RESERVATION REQUIRED - Matt Dinniman Book Signing
911618.description: Join bestselling author Matt Dinniman, best known for the Dungeon Crawler Carl series, as he greets fans and signs books. PLEASE NOTE: A reservation is required for this event. In addition to the reservation, you must purchase any Dungeon Crawler Carl book from the Barnes & Noble booth (at the front of Hall 1A) to join the signing line. Proof of purchase will be required. In order for Mr. Dinniman to meet the largest number of fans, there is a limit of two books signed per person. Reservations will open on September 29. Information about NYCC reservations.

904385.title: Transformers & G.I. Joe: A New Era for The Energon Universe
904385.description: The worlds of Transformers. G.I. Joe, and Void Rivals change forever - and this is THE panel to get all the details! Join superstars Robert Kirkman, Joshua Williamson, Dan Mora, Tom Reilly, Jorge Corona, Conor Hughes, and Skybound Executive Editor Ben Abernathy for all new Energon Universe revelations...and a special surprise giveaway for fans.
904385.people_list: Jorge Corona, Robert Kirkman, Conor Hughes, Joshua Williamson

909831.title: Drag Queen Panel
909831.description:
Get ready for a fabulous treat at NY Comic Con! Join us for a drag panel like no other, hosted by the dazzling Yuhua Hamasaki. She’ll be leading the charge as our glam squad of drag queens dish out their wildest behind-the-scenes tales from their showbiz adventures. Moderated by the amazing Peppermint! 

Whether you’re a die-hard drag fan or just here for the high-energy entertainment, this panel promises a whirlwind of sass, sparkle, and sheer fun. Don’t miss out—Yuhua and her fabulous crew are ready to serve up a Comic Con experience that’s anything but ordinary!

909579.title: Spotlight on Tomi Adeyemi
909579.description: Join Instant #1 New York Times-bestselling & Hugo-award winning fantasy author sensation Tomi Adeyemi as she discusses the earth-shaking conclusion to her Legacy of Orïsha series, Children of Anguish and Anarchy, which has a highly anticipated adaptation set for release in IMAX and theaters in 2027.

911155.title: Star Wars March
911155.description: Annual Star Wars parade through NYCC featuring 501st ECG, Rebel Legion Echo Base, Saber Guild Empire Temple, Mandalorian Mercs Falco Clan and Tri-State Droid Builders.

909657.title: Up Next From Marvel Television and Marvel Animation
909657.description: Join special guests for a look behind the scenes at Marvel’s upcoming Disney+ shows from Marvel Television and Marvel Animation.

909414.title: Critical Role Cosplay Meetup
909414.description: Bidet, hello bees, smiley day to ya! Calling all Critters to the Critical Role Cosplay Meetup. We will take cosplay photos by campaign, player, and specialty groups & pairings as well as a picture of all Critters who attend. Beware that spoiler photos are allowed! Use #NYCCCritters when sharing photos. Hosted by Kate The Great Cosplays, Photography by Rels.Photography

903422.title: Cinema Therapy LIVE: 5th Anniversary Panel
903422.description: With nearly 2M subscribers on YouTube, licensed therapist Jonathan Decker and professional filmmaker Alan Seawright passionately and hilariously explore the psychology of movies and how they can help us in real life. Known to Cinema Therapy fans as the "Internet Dads," these two will be sharing movie moments that have inspired or healed them, funny backstories about the channel's history, and engaging fans in a lively Q&A session. Keep hoping, keep healing, and watch movies!

903873.title: Legends Reborn: Iconic Comics, New Adventures on WEBTOON
903873.description: Your favorite comics book legends are getting a bold new chapter – this time in vertical scroll! WEBTOON has teamed up with iconic publishers to bring classic heroes, unforgettable stories and fan-favorite franchises to the world of webcomics. Discover how beloved titles are being reimagined for a new generation of fans, and get a behind-the-scenes look at the creative process that honors the originals while creating something totally fresh.

904408.title: Layer by Layer: Building Tiny Onion
904408.description: James Tynion IV and co chat about the journey to Tiny Onion. From the start of James career, to his newsletter, to building a company from scratch. The horror master tells all! The directors of Tiny Onion join James and share exclusive announcements!

904426.title: Justice Juniors Academy, presented by Capes For A Cos
904426.description: To attend this workshop - it is first come, first served. Limited space is available. Join us for an exciting and interactive superhero academy designed especially for our future heroes!  Young trainees will begin by taking the Superhero Pledge, vowing to use their powers to help those in need and restore hope to our planet.  Throughout the session, kids will rotate through hands-on breakout classes including choosing your superhero name, striking your signature superhero pose, and designing your very own uniform!  They will also participate in fun “power training” activities to explore special abilities like invisibility, telekinesis, and superhuman strength!  At the end of training, we'll host a heroic Show & Tell, where each mini-hero can show off what they’ve learned and created.  Every participant will leave with a special Superhero Certificate, officially declaring them a graduate of Superhero Training School!  This engaging, high-energy class encourages creativity, teamwork, and self-confidence, and is sure to be a highlight for both children and families alike!

909661.title: Bob’s Burgers
909661.description: Bob’s Burgers is heading to New York Comic Con! Join creator and executive producer Loren Bouchard and cast members H. Jon Benjamin, John Roberts, Kristen Schaal, Eugene Mirman, Dan Mintz and Larry Murphy as they celebrate the series’ milestone 300th episode with a lively discussion, behind-the-scenes stories, exclusive sneak peek clips, and plenty of laughs. Don’t miss your chance to catch the Belchers live at the Javits Center – Main Stage.

909215.title: Stitch & Mix: Crochet 101 Workshop [Reservation Required]
909215.description: Beginner or experienced, with our team, you'll learn how to make the cutest accessory in this event! We'll provide the tools and steps necessary, all you have to do is bring yourself! ‘With one knot at a time you’ll be able to pick up a new hobby and something cool to show off. Come join us and let's get knotty! Reservations required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

909733.title: Behind the Codec: The Voice Cast of Metal Gear Solid
909733.description: Kept you waiting, huh? Join the legendary voice cast behind Metal Gear Solid for a rare reunion at NYCC! David Hayter (Solid Snake), Jennifer Hale (Naomi Hunter), Christopher Randolph (Otacon), and Cam Clarke (Liquid Snake) come together to revisit the groundbreaking game that redefined cinematic storytelling in video games. From codec calls to cardboard boxes, this panel dives into the legacy, characters, and behind-the-scenes memories from one of the most iconic franchises in gaming history. Whether you're a FOXHOUND veteran or a newcomer to Shadow Moses, this is your mission—no stealth required.
909733.people_list: David Hayter, Jennifer Hale, Christopher Randolph, Cam Clarke, Trent Cannon

905894.title: TOUGEN ANKI: Exclusive Screening Panel
905894.description: Experience the world of TOUGEN ANKI at New York Comic Con 2025! TOUGEN ANKI, the anime that has gained global attention, is a new generation of dark hero anime based on Yura Urushibara’s hit manga. In a world where the bloodlines of Oni (demons) and Momotaro have been passed down through generations, inherited powers awaken, and high-stakes rivalries reignite. This exclusive NYCC event will feature a special screening. Don’t miss this rare opportunity to experience one of the most talked-about anime of 2025—with special giveaways, only at New York Comic Con!

901206.title: Behind the Magic: Navigating the Animation Development Pipeline
901206.description: Have you ever wondered how animated shows and films transform from a single idea into the stories you love? This panel pulls back the curtain on the studio development pipeline, uncovering the steps that turn creative sparks into fully realized projects. From crafting loglines and one-pagers to developing pitches and bibles, industry professionals will share their insider knowledge, tackle challenges, and offer best practices for navigating this complex process. Join T.J. Sullivan (Madagascar: A Little Wild), Pat Stout (Sentinel 6), Ben Feldman (Adventure Noises), Phoebe Hart (Bug Diner), and Kate Costello (The Land of Boggs) as they dive into how projects are brought to life and what it takes to thrive in today’s fast-moving animation landscape. Whether you're an aspiring creator or simply fascinated by the magic behind the scenes, this panel is your all-access pass to the journey from concept to screen.
901206.people_list: Samantha Goff, Katelyn Costello, Benjamin Feldman, Patrick Stout, Thomas Sullivan, Phoebe Hart, Monique Henry-Hudson

910188.title: Exclusive Premiere of The Littles + Cast Panel featuring the Stars of M3GAN, Shadowhunters, and Pretty Little Liars
910188.description: Win a Nintendo Switch 2 and more prizes at the exclusive premiere of The Littles, a chilling short film starring Violet McGraw (Marvel’s Thunderbolts, M3GAN 2.0), Janel Parrish (Pretty Little Liars), and Dominic Sherwood (Shadowhunters). From writer Andrew Duplessie (American Horror Story), the story begins with a loose floorboard—where a faint noise and eerie glow draw Juliet toward a discovery like no other. The cast is sticking around after the premiere for a Q&A, autographs, and the big giveaway!
910188.people_list: Andrew Duplessie, Violet McGraw, Dominic Sherwood, Janel Parrish

911627.title: Tomi Adeyemi Book Signing
911627.description: Join Instant #1 New York Times-bestselling & Hugo-award winning fantasy author sensation Tomi Adeyemi as she greets fans and signs books. One book personalized, up to three total books signed, no posed photos. Books will be available for purchase at the Barnes & Noble booth adjacent to the author signing tables.

909599.title: Pin Trader's Meetup
909599.description:
Join us for the second official Enamel Pin Traders Meetup at New York Comic Con!

Whether you’re a seasoned trader or just starting your collection, this is the perfect place to swap, show off, and discover new pins — and maybe make some awesome new friends along the way!

Got a jacket, lanyard, or backpack full of your favorite pins? Looking for that one design to complete your set? Collectors from all fandoms are welcome — Disney, Loungefly, FiGPiN, Pokémon, Marvel, Star Wars, anime, and beyond. If it’s shiny and has a pin back, it belongs here!

We'll be doing giveaways throughout the event!

909426.title: Gotta Go Fast! Sonic the Hedgehog Meetup
909426.description: Calling all Sonic Cosplayers! Suit up with your best Sonic the Hedgehog cosplay and speed into action to join us for the Ultimate Sonic fan meetup! Whether you're cruisin' in Sonic's shoes, or embracing your inner villian with Eggman's genius, this is your chance to show off your look and connect with others who love the Blue Blur just as much! It'll be Way Past Cool!

909832.title: Shutter Presents: Evolution of Queer Horror/ Queens of the Dead and Dragula
909832.description:
Just in time for spooky season, dive into the glam-gore world of queer horror with a spotlight on Queens of the Dead, a sequin-soaked zombie spectacle from Tina Romero, daughter of horror legend George A. Romero, alongside the stars of Dragula.

Moderated by NYT critic Erik Piepenburg, this panel features cast, and  creators, serving behind-the-scenes stories and insight into how queer voices are reshaping the genre—one blood-splattered heel at a time.

909580.title: Spotlight on Travis Baldree
909580.description: Join Travis Baldree, the bestselling and wildly popular author Legends & Lattes and Bookshops &  Bonedust, as he discusses his latest novel, Brigands & Breadknives.

911156.title: Star Wars Storytime
911156.description: Led by an award-winning New York State licensed librarian with over fifteen years of youth services experiences. Star Wars-themed books, music, crafts, and special appearances by some friends from a galaxy far, far away. LFL-recognized Star Wars charity costuming clubs will be in Family HQ in Hall 1E all four days, raising money for Make-A-Wish.

911056.title: How Influencers Drive Music Discovery
911056.description:
Influencers are increasingly becoming the tastemakers driving streaming spikes, chart placements, and even tour demand. This panel brings together influencer marketers, artists, and creators to explore the new gatekeepers of music discovery. We’ll dig into how songs go viral, the blurred lines between promotion and authenticity, and what it takes to build lasting impact beyond the trend cycle.

Whether you’re in music, entertainment, publishing, or any field looking to connect with audiences in fresh ways, this session offers a behind-the-curtain look at the strategies, successes, and stumbles shaping the future of influencer marketing.
911056.people_list: Josh Bernstein, Josh Goldfeder, Pablo Douzoglou, Sean Rameau, Skye Sweetnam

909581.title: Beyond Boundaries: The Art of Genre Bending
909581.description: Rules were meant to be broken and genres were meant to be mashed -- or however the saying goes. Leave your ideas of conventional genre at the door and join some of your favorite authors who write books in all different genres. They don't let one genre define them! Come here how they deftly move between fantasy, romance, horror, and everything in between. Featuring authors Amanda Foody, C.L. Herman, Marie Lu, Bethany C. Morrow, and Veronica Roth.
909581.people_list: Veronica Roth, Amanda Foody, C. L. Herman, Marie Lu, Chuck Tingle, Bethany C Morrow

903500.title: Sandstorm Comics Panel
903500.description: Sharing details on some of our new releases for 2025 and that have been made from the writers from the Arab World. These books will be available at NYCC 2025

909658.title: STAR TREK UNIVERSE
909658.description: The fan-favorite Star Trek universe panel returns to New York Comic Con, featuring exclusive sneak peeks and conversations with cast members and producers from the Paramount+ Original STAR TREK: STRANGE NEW WORLDS and the upcoming new series STAR TREK: STARFLEET ACADEMY. Plus, more exciting reveals and surprises for fans in attendance that you won't want to miss!

909665.title: MARVEL COMICS: Next Big Thing
909665.description: The biggest comics panel of the weekend arrives as Editor-in-Chief C.B. Cebulski,  VP & Executive Editor Nick Lowe, Ultimate Editor Wil Moss, writer Phillip Kennedy Johnson (Incredible Hulk) and other superstar creators reveal the future of the Marvel Universe while giving a sneak peek at the stories every fan will be talking about next year, including Ultimate Endgame, the climactic chapter of the hit new Ultimate line. Make sure to stick around until the end of the discussion to score an exclusive giveaway comic book.

910290.title: Shudder Presents: Evolution of Queer Horror/ Queens of the Dead and Dragula
910290.description:
