Just in time for spooky season, dive into the glam-gore world of queer horror with a spotlight on Queens of the Dead, a sequin-soaked zombie spectacle from Tina Romero, daughter of horror legend George A. Romero, alongside the stars of Dragula.

Moderated by NYT critic Erik Piepenburg, this panel features cast, and  creators, serving behind-the-scenes stories and insight into how queer voices are reshaping the genre—one blood-splattered heel at a time.

911594.title: RESERVATION REQUIRED -- George R.R. Martin Book Signing
911594.description: Join internationally bestselling author George R. R. Martin, best known for his series A Song of Ice and Fire, as he greets fans and signs books. In order for Mr. Martin to meet the largest number of fans, there is a limit of one book only per person with no personalization and no posed photos. PLEASE NOTE: A reservation is required for this event. Reservations will open on September 29. About NYCC reservations.

909820.title: Mixed Material Embroidery with Ribbon, Beads, and Floss [Separately Ticketed]
909820.description: Looking to add a couture touch to your costumes? Layering and combining materials is a fantastic way to create depth and texture in your embroidery work.  In this class Cowbutt Crunchies will teach hand embroidery techniques such as basic stitches, ribbon embroidery, beading, and more to create beautiful, dimensional floral embellishments that can be added to your next costume. **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

909662.title: Tubi Presents BREAKING BEAR
909662.description: BREAKING BEAR is a fur-flying, law-breaking, forest-saving rampage following a dysfunctional family of bears who go full criminal to stop frackers, mobsters, and a psychotic wolf pack from destroying their home. As they spiral deeper into the criminal abyss, they face off against biker gangs, an egomaniacal news anchor, and their own spectacular talent for self-sabotage. Join panelists, Oscar winner Brendan Fraser, Emmy winner Sarah Michelle Gellar, Emmy winner Annie Murphy and Elizabeth Hurley.  BREAKING BEAR will premiere on Tubi March 2026.

909711.title: Playbill presents: The Big Broadway Nerd Panel
909711.description: Theatre is filled with passionate artists creating stunning new works, and many of those artists are giant nerds! Playbill returns to New York Comic Con in 2025 with even MORE of Broadway’s Biggest Nerds to share how fantasy, comic-books, and science fiction have had in inspiring and engaging their performances, personas, and personal lives.

909833.title: Meet and Greet Queens of the Dead
909833.description: Up close and personal, meet the panel and get your photos and merch

911157.title: Blast-A-Trooper
911157.description: Interactive experience to “blast” Stormtroopers and Mandalorians with foam dart blasters; fundraiser for charity led by 501st ECG and Mandalorian Mercs Falco Clan.

894569.title: Cosplay in 3 Dimensions: Software Skills from 3D Modeling to Patternmaking
894569.description: Have you ever wanted to design and 3D print your own cosplay props, accessories, and armor? Want to learn how to use 3D to make patterns for EVA foam armor and sewing? Join cosplay veterans as we discuss how to use digital tools of the trade to take your cosplay to the next level! Featuring demos of CAD software and 3D technology like Fusion 360 and CLO 3D.
894569.people_list: Jeffrey Bigelow, Raisa Karim, MEGAN DELLARIO

909431.title: The Official Boricua-Verse Meetup
909431.description: The official meetup of The BoricuaVerse for cosplayers with Puerto Rican themed cosplays celebrating the rich culture of the island. All are welcome. Hosted by NYCOSPLAYER and FLORIS_LILIUM

904354.title: Frame by Frame: Behind-the-Scenes with Hollywood’s Visual Storytellers
904354.description:
Featuring creatives from The Handmaid’s Tale, SurrealEstate, Apple Cider Vinegar, Pam &
Tommy, and more!

Step behind the scenes of popular film and television projects with the creatives who craft every
chilling, thrilling, and mind-bending moment! From sound editing to design and storytelling, this
panel spotlights the behind-the-camera artists who bring your favorite worlds to life, frame by
frame!

With Annette Davey (Editor of Apple Cider Vinegar), Bella Gonzales (Director of Photography of
Alien: Earth and The Twisted Tale of Amanda Knox), Burton LeBlanc (Makeup Designer of The
Handmaid’s Tale), Ralph Jean-Pierre (Editor of Tokyo Vice and The Beast in Me), and Spencer
Creaghan (Composer of SurrealEstate, Slasher, and Hot Wheels). Moderated by Marissa Hill
(Executive Producer at Shade Studios and Host at ShadeTV). Part 2 of Impact24 PR’s Panel
Superblock Series. Follow us on Instagram: @impact24pr

903910.title: Wellness for Geeks Who Sit
903910.description: Calling all gamers, writers, cosplayers, artists, and desk dwellers! This workshop is designed to help you with those aches and pains that we develop from being hunched over the latest project or finishing a fun campaign. Discover the secrets to conquering seated life and beyond with strength movements and mobility stretches. Plus, unlock the key to sustained energy with bonus nutritional tips and upgrades featuring Marvel Fitness Deck cards! Get ready to level up your wellness game and experience cons without taking (too much) damage. This is a seated movement workshop tailored with various body types in mind and is for anyone who spends a lot of time sitting down.

903234.title: The Legend of Sippy: A Cup Awakens
903234.description: To attend this workshop - it is first come, first served. Limited space is available. Calling all young heroes, rebels, and adventurers! In this fun and creative workshop, kids will decorate their very own plastic tumbler using awesome, colorful designs inspired by their favorite comics, cartoons, and characters. With easy-to-use sticker-style transfers (DTF), little creators will: • Choose their favorite designs from a galaxy of options • Learn how to safely decorate their cup with help from our team • Add fun sparkles, names, or symbols to make it truly theirs This is a beginner-friendly activity designed especially for kids! No heat tools or sharp items—just imagination, color, and creativity. Each child will take home a one-of-a-kind tumbler perfect for juice boxes, super-sips, or snack-time in style. ⸻ 👶 Great For: • Ages 5+ (littles are welcome but we don’t think they could decorate it so their parents would have to do it for them) • Kids who love superheroes, anime, or magic worlds • Crafty little creators and their families All supplies are included—just bring your imagination!
903234.people_list: Jami Giametta, Lois Mendez Catlin, Sean Mendez Catlin
people: Lois Mendez Catlin (Dra. FabuLois Mendez Catlin)

905843.title: Seeing Yourself: Queer Representation in Manga
905843.description: Manga has always been a place that’s had stories for and about all kinds of folks. And it’s through this variety that many queer people have been able to see themselves, not only in popular genres like BL and Yuri but also in horror, fantasy, sci-fi and many other kinds of manga. Join this panel of queer manga experts as they talk about their own experiences seeing themselves and offer recommendations for amazing stories brimming with pride.

909582.title: Separately Ticketed Event - Spotlight on Joe Hill
909582.description: New York Comic Con is thrilled to welcome Joe Hill, bestselling author of The Fireman, Heart-shaped Box, and many other books and collections as he discusses his latest work, King Sorrow. This is a separately ticketed event (details to come) and will include a signed copy of King Sorrow.

911376.title: Beyond Boundaries - Post Panel Book Signing
911376.description: Join authors from the "Beyond Boundaries" panel as they meet fans and sign books.  In order for the authors to meet the maximum number of fans, one book personalized, up to three total books signed, no posed photos. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
911376.people_list: Amanda Foody, C. L. Herman, Marie Lu, Bethany C Morrow, Veronica Roth, Chuck Tingle

903875.title: Queer Love: Holding Space for Authentic LGBTQ+ Stories
903875.description: The future of LGBTQ+ storytelling is vibrant, unapologetic, and more authentic than ever. A new generation of creators is sharing their voices without compromise, connecting with millions of readers who are hungry for stories that feel real, personal, and deeply human. From tender love stories to bold explorations of identity, these works are ensuring queer narratives aren’t just included—they’re leading the conversation. Join WEBTOON and some of today’s most popular LGBTQ voices as we explore how authentic creators are shaping the next chapter of LGBTQ+ storytelling – and why that matters now more than ever.

909563.title: MAPPING MYTH & MAGIC: Rebuilding OZ for a New Generation
909563.description:
OZ is more than a fairy tale — in this panel, the creative team behind ULTIMATE OZ UNIVERSE: THE LOST LANDS, OZ pop-culture influencers, and OZ historians, bring fans inside the world building behind this iconic universe. Fans will get an inside look at how they rebuilt and reconnected the countries and lands of OZ for a new generation. This literary and pop culture deep-dive explores the mythic space and taps into the fresh corners of mythology, repositioning the graphic novel as the future of OZ!

As of right now we have Larry King (writer and producing partner of Ultimate OZ Universer: The Lost Lands) and Tori Calamito (biggest OZ influencer known for the OzVlog) confirmed for the panel. We are working on getting 2 others confirmed for the panel to talk all things Oz. Thanks!
909563.people_list: Larry King, Axel Alonso, Victoria Calamito, Kevin McCollum,  Down the Yellow Brick Pod

896310.title: Yen Press Industry Panel
896310.description: For over a decade, Yen Press has been one of the biggest publishers of manga, releasing the likes of Black Butler, Fruits Basket and Toilet-bound Hanako-kun. Yen Press has also given a home to fan favorite categories such as light novels, audiobooks and manhwa. Join us for new announcements and Q&A!

909659.title: MORTAL KOMBAT II Feature Film
909659.description: Return to the brutal glory of the Earthrealm in New Line Cinema’s all-new MORTAL KOMBAT II! The Warner Bros. Pictures presentation at NYCC will offer fans a glimpse into the latest high-stakes installment in the blockbuster video game-inspired film franchise.  The panel guests include stars Karl Urban, Adeline Rudolph, Tati Gabrielle and Martyn Ford, along with filmmakers Simon McQuoid and Ed Boon, moderated by a special guest.

909666.title: Marvel: Comics to Screen
909666.description: It’s an unprecedented meeting of page and screen as Marvel Comics Editor-in-Chief C.B. Cebulski and special guests explore the journey Marvel storytelling takes from the comic page to the screen, including insider insights and unheard anecdotes! And that’s not all – fans who stick around till the end will receive an exclusive giveaway comic book!

893125.title: Empowered Through Expression: Cosplay and Content Creation for People with Disabilities
893125.description: Join The Apex for an inspiring and fun-filled panel, Empowered Through Expression: Cosplay and Content Creation for People with Disabilities! Discover how cosplay and content creation can be transformative tools for self-expression, confidence, and connection. Learn from passionate creators about how they’ve overcome challenges, built thriving communities, and embraced their unique identities through creativity. Whether you're a seasoned cosplayer, a budding content creator, or just curious about how these mediums can empower individuals with disabilities, this panel offers practical tips, heartfelt stories, and lots of laughs. Don’t miss this opportunity to celebrate creativity, inclusion, and the power of fandom to bring people together. Come ready to be inspired and leave ready to create!
893125.people_list: Justin Santiago, Alfredo Cordovez, Hector Barreto, Joseph Munisteri
people: Joseph Munisteri (Joseph Munisteri / Butterflies in Space LLC)

893146.title: Build a Mimic Dice Box with The Artist and The Carpenter [Separately Ticketed]
893146.description: Come build your very own Mimic Dice box guided by the Artist and the carpenter! Guests will assemble their own Foldy the Dice Guardian with the provided tools and materials. Foldys hold 6 sets of dice, feature a classic folding accordion design, have two magnetic lids that double as dice trays, and are made of hardwood cherry. Adventurers should be sure not to miss this! **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

909411.title: Marvel Rivals Meetup!
909411.description: We are undefeatable! Join NikiMuffin, Kenya_G.Love, CucumberCosplay and AnnieLeeCosplay for a meetup of the ages. Whether you're bringing a Squirrel Stampede with Squirrel Girl, tanking with Groot, or doing that...fancy emote with Venom, there is space for you. Come on down and meet fellow fans and have an ultimate experience!
909411.people_list: Lyndsey Petrofsky, Veronika Avloshenko, Jaimee Giorgi, Kenya Gallegos

904081.title: PW's More To Come: The 700th Episode Spectacular
904081.description: Kate Fitzsimons, Calvin Reid, Meg Lemke, and Heidi MacDonald have been podcasting about comics for 14 years, and now they're celebrating their 700th Episode - and you’re invited! To mark this very special event, More to Come will record their 700th episode live at NYCC, with an all-star line-up of guests, including special guests!  Expect surprises, scoops and lots of laughs in this once in a lifetime gala spectacular.

909601.title: Writing Workshop: Carving Out Your Niche
909601.description: To attend this workshop - it is first come, first served. Limited space is available. Writers: grab your pen and notebook and join authors Matt Dinniman (Dungeon Crawler Carl), Jim Butcher (The Dresden Files), Alexandria Bellefleur (The Devil She Knows), Kimberly Lemming (I Got Abducted by Aliens and Now I’m Trapped in a Rom-Com), and Rachel Harrison (Play) as they do a deep dive on creating writing your niche. Featuring insight into their creation process, exercises to flex your writing muscles, and invaluable advice on finding your voice as a writer, this isn’t one to miss!
909601.people_list: Alexandria Bellefleur, Jim Butcher, Matt Dinniman, Rachel Harrison, Kimberly Lemming

904404.title: Cyanide & Happiness: How To Make A Funny
904404.description: Join the crazy minds behind Cyanide & Happiness as they draw live in front of you using the audiences suggestive prompts and topics. Think you know funny?

894530.title: Swag Swap
894530.description: Do you have lightly used, unused, or brand new swag want to send to a better home? Then this event is for you. SWAG Swap is where you can bring your swag and trade for other swag of your interest. Bring your Funkos, games, comics, manga, action figures, apparel, etc to swag swap. There's something for everyone!

909583.title: Scream Reads: Books to Keep You Up at Night
909583.description: Join this collection of critically acclaimed and bestselling authors as they dive into the horror genre and books that will make your hair stand on end.
909583.people_list: Cynthia St. Aubin, Bethany C Morrow, Mira Grant, Mary Roach, Laurel Leffler, Codie Crowley

911058.title: The Art of the Interview with Josh Horowitz
911058.description: Join the creator and host of the acclaimed Happy Sad Confused podcast for a masterclass on interviewing. Josh will cover topics such as finding your voice as an interviewer, dos and don'ts that have served him well, plus practical tips for building a podcast and crafting a career in the entertainment industry. This exclusive NYCC masterclass is one you won't want to miss!

909663.title: FX’s “The Beauty” Sneak-Peek and Q&A
909663.description: Be among the first to catch a sneak-peek of FX’s “The Beauty,” a new international thriller from executive producer, writer, and director Ryan Murphy. Join stars Evan Peters, Anthony Ramos, Jeremy Pope, Rebecca Hall and Ashton Kutcher as they discuss filming the sci-fi action series across New York, Paris, Venice and Rome. Based on the comic books of the same name by Jeremy Haun and Jason A. Hurley, a sexually transmitted virus makes those affected more beautiful, but with deadly consequences.  FX’s “The Beauty” premieres on Hulu in early 2026.

909734.title: Part of Your World: The Voices of The Little Mermaid
909734.description: Make a splash with the voices behind Disney’s The Little Mermaid! Join Jodie Benson (Ariel) and Christopher Daniel Barnes (Prince Eric) for a delightful dive into the world of the 1989 animated classic that stole hearts and inspired dreams. Perfect for fans of all ages, this enchanting panel will be filled with heartwarming stories, fun behind-the-scenes memories, and plenty of Disney magic. Whether you’ve loved Ariel since “Part of Your World” or first met Prince Eric on the shores of Atlantica, this is your chance to celebrate the timeless tale of love, adventure, and following your heart.
909734.people_list: Christopher Daniel Barnes, Jodi Benson, Ashley V Robinson

895163.title: J-Novel Club NYCC 2025 Industry Announcements
895163.description: Join J-Novel Club at NYCC 2025 as we unveil the latest manga and light novel series being added to our extensive catalog! If time permits, we'll be sure to answer a couple of questions from the audience too!

903455.title: Making Monsters
903455.description: Step into the shadows with an industry pro as they reveal the blood, sweat, and silicone behind creating unforgettable movie monsters. From foam latex fiends to full-body nightmares, this panel dives into the techniques, tools, and tenacity it takes to build a creature—and a career—in special effects. Whether you're just starting out or ready to level up, come learn how to turn your monsters (and your hustle) into movie magic. Stick around for a live demonstration where nightmares are created in real time. Stick around for a live demonstration where rubber, paint, and pure chaos collide to create something horrifyingly unforgettable.

904744.title: Up Past Bedtime: Crafting Unputdownable Plots
904744.description: We’ve all been there—promising “just one more chapter” only to realize it’s 2 a.m. and you still can’t stop reading. What makes a story so gripping that it hijacks your sleep schedule? Join these bestselling authors as they reveal how they build immersive worlds, ratchet up tension, and deliver gasp-worthy twists. Whether you're a writer or a reader, don’t miss this behind-the-scenes look at the storytelling magic that keeps us turning pages deep into the night.
904744.people_list: Dana Schwartz, Erin A Craig, Shalini Abeysekara, Kristen Pipps, Megan Shepherd

909667.title: Jurassic World: Chaos Theory - The Final Season
909667.description: Join executive producer Scott Kreamer along with series cast including Sean Giambrone (Ben), Kiersten Kelly (Brooklynn), Kausar Mohammed (Yaz), Raini Rodriguez (Sammy), and Paul-Mikél Williams (Darius) as they offer an exclusive first look inside in the final season of DreamWorks Animation, Universal Pictures and Amblin Entertainment’s hit Netflix series Jurassic World: Chaos Theory.

909434.title: DCeased vs. Marvel Horror Cosplay Meetup
909434.description:
The undead have taken over NYCC… and they look incredible.
Cosplayers, it’s time to rise from the grave. Celebrate your love for horror comics with zombified takes on Marvel and DC icons! Whether you’re a decayed Superman, a gruesome Spider-Man, or a grotesque Wonder Woman, this meetup is for all things gory, ghastly, and geeky. Come in full undead glam for haunting group shots and chilling cosplayer collabs. Brains optional. Creativity essential. Hosted by Shady Haze and DC Cosplayers East

Check out the FB event: https://www.facebook.com/share/19V6kD3isR/ 

You can also check out the DC Universe meetup on Saturday 3PM by the staircase at the special events hall: https://www.facebook.com/events/560931479952490
909434.people_list: Carlos Smith, Michael Gilbert, Angelo Maione, Robert Burdi, Sophia Elwell, Izabelle Garcia, Hazel-Lovely Saunders, Taylor Van Ackem

904751.title: Shadowy Scholarships and Mysterious Manuscripts: A Discussion of the Dark Academia Phenomenon
904751.description: Cloaked in candlelight, dusted with secrets, and steeped in the obsession of knowledge—Dark Academia has captivated readers with its moody halls, morally gray characters, and the tantalizing blend of intellect and danger. But what lies beneath the tweed blazers and Latin quotes? Join these authors for a deep dive into the genre that romanticizes intellect, isolation, and the pursuit of forbidden knowledge. Together, they’ll explore what draws readers into this shadowy aesthetic, how they craft mysterious atmospheres and haunted institutions, and why Dark Academia continues to resonate. Whether you're a longtime lover of dusty tomes and secret societies or just curious about the trend, this panel offers insight, intrigue, and a touch of literary darkness.
904751.people_list: Maggie Stiefvater, Kristen Pipps, Katie Zhao, Elle Gonzalez Rose

903233.title: Sippin’ No Jutsu: Custom Glass Workshop
903233.description: To attend this workshop - it is first come, first served. Limited space is available. Ready to level up your crafting skills? Join Underground Nerd for a hands-on fandom-fueled workshop where you’ll learn how to customize your very own glass tumbler or shot glass using Direct to Film (DTF) transfer techniques. Whether you’re repping your favorite anime clan, gaming guild, or comic book multiverse, this workshop will walk you step-by-step through the process of: • Prepping your glassware for transfers • Applying DTF designs with precision • Avoiding common beginner mistakes • Sealing and curing your custom creation for long-lasting flair No experience required—just bring your inner otaku and your creative energy. We’ll provide everything you need, including fandom-inspired DTF designs, high-quality glassware, and tools. At the end, you’ll walk away with your own personalized glass tumbler or shot glass—perfect for your next anime binge, DnD session, or shelf display.

909716.title: Cookie Run: Learn to Play Experience at NYCC
909716.description:
Step into the whimsical world of Cookie Run at New York Comic Con! Whether you’re a seasoned gamer or brand new to the franchise, our Learn to Play activation is the perfect way to jump in. Guided by our friendly demo team, you’ll explore the vibrant Cookie Run Kingdom, master the core rules, and experience the excitement of gameplay firsthand.

Come for the fun, stay for the cookie. No prior experience required - let’s play!

909487.title: NYCC Charity Art Auction
909487.description: You Can Make A Difference! The NYCC Charity Art Auction benefits St. Jude Children's Research Hospital; an internationally recognized organization for its pioneering research and treatment of children with cancer and other catastrophic diseases. Your participation in this event will help support lifesaving research and treatment for the children of St. Jude. Come down and bid with other art enthusiasts for the chance to own a piece of original art from some of your favorite creators, all for a good cause! Have Fun. Get Art. Save Lives.

902659.title: Divas & Death Saves: A Dragventuring D&D Live Play
902659.description:
This is a 90 minute, Live Play, D&D One Shot adventure with a PG-13ish rating. 
We join a team of four Drag-venturers as they compete in a Drag Race/Dragula/King of Drag inspired show with a high fantasy twist. 
We will begin with Lipsync Introductions to our cast, followed by our Mini-Challenge with Audience Participation. 
The Maxi-challenge is  "Talent Under Fire!" where our dragventurers must perform a group number during combat against an unknown foe! 
Will they Slay or will they Sashay Away?
902659.people_list: Cameron Conlan, Skylar Hoelscher, Deanna Fleysher

909589.title: Gotham Comedy Live at NYCC
909589.description: Gotham Comedy Club has partnered with NYCC to bring you a Saturday night of iconic stand-up comedy live at the Javits Center. Join us for a lineup featuring some of the best comedians the city has to offer. Whether it’s absurd, observational or anything in between it will be a night to remember because it’s curated by the premier comedy club in the city.

903475.title: Comics Reading Comics
903475.description:
Presented by Aidan Ewing and Drew Tessier, founder of the New York Queer Comedy Festival, Comics Reading Comics is an exciting live presentation that brings your favorite comic books to life! With panels from classic comic book stories projected on the big screen, some of New York’s most notable LGBTQ+ stand-up comedians will perform live stage readings of iconic comic book scenes, bringing a fresh perspective to the material through a queer lens. The show kicks off with a nerdy stand-up set, followed by a journey through the history of a specific comic book character. Previous iterations of the show have chronicled the history of the Marvel Comics character Dazzler. We dive deep into their origins and evolution in the medium, all while enjoying engaging, live readings of comic book stories and panels. With support from Geeks Out, performances have been held at Caveat NYC and Flame Con. Comics Reading Comics is a hilarious blend of history, queerness, and geek culture—making it a must-see for comic and comedy lovers alike!

Performance video: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ovKrQ_TmXaXyEwHlG6yfbaAq7T3_EHoI/view?usp=sharing

909660.title: Sony Pictures Panel & Footage
909660.description: Sony Pictures will host a panel with special guests and showcase new footage from films soon to be released exclusively in movie theaters. Please be advised that materials shown at this presentation are intended for mature audiences.

909407.title: Krying about Kojima: A Millennial Mediated Meetup for Death Stranding (and Metal Gear Solid)
909407.description:
Do you love Movies, political intrigue, espionage, the proliferation of memes in our society? serious people doing silly things?

Come find your people here.

909668.title: Shudder is Here to Scare the S*** Out of You
909668.description: Shudder’s head of programming Sam Zimmerman leads a discussion on the current state of horror, what scares us the most, and the future of the genre, including a look back at some of the most popular titles from Shudder's 10-year history and what’s to come to the streamer.

909596.title: Cosplay Central Crown Championships
909596.description: An amazing showcase of the best Cosplayers from the region, come support your local cosplayers or just admire the astounding craftsmanship on display! At this Championship incredible Cosplayers will battle it out onstage to be chosen as the New York regional winner. Our NYCC winner will go on to compete against the cosplayers selected at  Emerald City Comic Con, Florida Supercon, and C2E2, to decide the overall US Champion who will head to C2E2 in 2026 and compete in the Final for the Global Cosplay Central Crown!

909808.title: Making a Cosplay Prop with Masked Dad Workshop [Reservation Required]
909808.description: Learn to build a cosplay prop with Masked Dad Workshop, a cosplay supply company founded by two dads of color in NYC. This hands-on workshop will teach you essential tips and tricks to get started, and give you the chance to ask questions in person with experienced, award-winning cosplayers. **A reservation Is required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

904800.title: The VelociPastor 2.22 You Will (not) Believe A Man Can Turn Into A Dinosaur
904800.description: The team being the cult hit film, The VelociPastor, are hitting NYCC to talk about the cult around the first film, premiere clips from the upcoming sequel, do giveaways, and answer fan questions!

904290.title: Travel Channel/HBO Max's Paranormal Caught On Camera Season 9 - Still bringing the scares
904290.description: For Nine Seasons, the hit show Paranormal Caught On Camera has been bringing spooky footage from around the world into the homes of viewers. As one of the only remaining paranormal shows with new seasons on network TV, the show has traveled the globe searching for folklore, weird tales of monsters, and of course ghosts. Join the cast for a spirited conversation about making the show, and the behind the scenes secrets.

909418.title: The Lineup's Horror Cosplay Meetup
909418.description: Do you love all things horrifying? The unsettling and the macabre? Slashers, monsters, and ghouls galore? Show up in your most chilling horror cosplay for a ghastly group picture—or swing by in your civvies to talk terror with likeminded fans. Guests who join us will have the opportunity to enter giveaways to take home some awesome horror swag! Stay tuned for more info on the-line-up.com

909840.title: George R. R. Martin hosts Howard Waldrop Short Films Screening
909840.description: George RR Martin takes us on a journey into worlds created by the late great Howard Waldrop. Join us for a special screening of Mary Margaret Road-Grader which transports us to a post-apocalyptic Indigenous world. Stakes are high for a new and controversial contender as she fights for her place amidst changing traditions and tricked-out tractors. Followed by The Ugly Chickens where we venture into a world of mystery and optimism. Upon learning that the supposedly extinct dodo bird might still exist, ornithology professor Paula Linberl sets out on a cross-country expedition to unravel the truth. Two science fiction short stories unlike any other finally being brought to the screen.

903655.title: Vampire Freaks presents: Vampirism Through the Perspective of BIPOC
903655.description:
This year is the year to rise from the coffin with a special message for NYCC 2025! Horror is political and was conjured by the fear of the unknown. Although horror was introduced as a means of entertainment, it also served as a form of education. The message has stayed the same since its conception. However, as the horror genre evolved, it’s painfully evident that there is still much to be desired regarding representation. If marginalized voices created the horror genre, why is another demographic still disproportionately represented in these stories?

The concept of vampires has fascinated and terrified many, and it’s deeply rooted in many different cultures. Films and shows like Vamp, From Dusk Till Dawn, Blade, Queen of the Damned, Interview with the Vampire, and Sinners highlight people of color and LGBTQ+ individuals, signaling a gradual shift in the right direction. I reach out to you, fellow vampires, and those aspiring to be vampires. Step out of the tomb, fly here as either human or bat, or take the MTA (we don’t judge) and listen to us discuss the importance of representation. What does the future of horror hold, specifically for what vampires represent? We will come bearing gifts such as fresh blood, immortality, and giveaways, thanks to Vampire Freaks. So, as Akasha once said, "My children, I have come to give you the world. Join me, or die."
903655.people_list: Jacqueline Martinez, Julio De Leon, Kendell Burton, DeShon Elem

911619.title: RESERVATION REQUIRED - Matt Dinniman Book Signing
911619.description: Join bestselling author Matt Dinniman, best known for the Dungeon Crawler Carl series, as he greets fans and signs books. PLEASE NOTE: A reservation is required for this event. In addition to the reservation, you must purchase any Dungeon Crawler Carl book from the Barnes & Noble booth (at the front of Hall 1A) to join the signing line. Proof of purchase will be required. In order for Mr. Dinniman to meet the largest number of fans, there is a limit of two books signed per person. Reservations will open on September 29. Information about NYCC reservations.

909585.title: Make Some Noise: Abrams Fanfare Panel
909585.description: Make some noise with Abrams to celebrate a new addition to our graphic novel imprint for young readers, Abrams Fanfare. Hear all about the new authors and titles, including graphic novels for early, middle-grade, and young adult readers, that will be part of the imprint in 2025 and 2026!

909586.title: Human Nature: Darren Aronofsky Breaks New Ground in Comics
909586.description: Panel Description: From the creative team behind the films Black Swan and The Whale, Human Nature marks Darren Aronofsky's bold debut in the world of comics. He joins forces with longtime collaborator Ari Handel, writer Jeff Welch, and artist Martín Morazzo, known for his work on Ice Cream Man, to create a darkly funny and deeply unsettling graphic novel trilogy. The story follows Duke, a once-average man who becomes a billionaire chicken tycoon obsessed with living forever. With surreal twists, razor-sharp satire, and unforgettable visuals, Human Nature dives into themes of power, ego, and humanity's refusal to accept mortality. Book One arrives in Spring 2026, but fans can get an early look at NYCC. A limited edition signed preview comic is available exclusively at the Abrams ComicArts booth.

909587.title: What Comes Next?: A Nonfiction Insider’s Look at How To Get Published
909587.description: Join nonfiction literary agent Alia Hanna Habib (Take It From Me) as she offers up some tips, insights, and behind-the-scenes tools of the trade to help writers decipher what happens once you have a pitch, proposal, or book.

910118.title: Playbill presents: Little Shop of Horrors on Broadway
910118.description: Cast and creatives of the award-winning New York revival of Little Shop of Horrors gather to discuss the hit musical comedy’s deep roots in American theater, film, and pop culture; the thrills of performing it live on stage; and what keeps audiences and theater-makers screaming “Feed Me!” more than four decades after its debut.

911158.title: Blast-A-Trooper
911158.description: Interactive experience to “blast” Stormtroopers and Mandalorians with foam dart blasters; fundraiser for charity led by 501st ECG and Mandalorian Mercs Falco Clan.

904769.title: K-Pop Dance Performance: Who wanna rock with Can’t Dance Crew?!
904769.description: Can’t Dance Crew is a New Jersey-based k-pop cover team that have been dancing as a group of friends for 6+ years! You can find us on YouTube with a channel of 85,000+ subscribers, or you might have seen us competing in Korea or across the U.S.. Come join us for some fun and get your lightsticks and fanchants ready! https://www.youtube.com/@CantDanceCrew

909670.title: Nickelodeon’s Avatar: The Last Airbender 20th Anniversary Panel
909670.description: 20 Years. 4 Elements. 1 Avatar. Nickelodeon is celebrating Avatar: The Last Airbender’s 20th anniversary with a panel that will take fans on a special journey through the legacy of the Avatar-verse. Join original voice cast members as they celebrate one of the most beloved animated series of all time. Yip Yip!

909675.title: Women of Marvel
909675.description: The Women of Marvel Panel returns to New York Comic Con! Talent from across the Marvel Universe assemble to talk about their work, the evolution of fandom, inspirational characters, and being a part of Marvel’s 85-year legacy, while teasing what’s next in Marvel’s women-led titles.  Plus, be sure to stay until the end for the exclusive giveaway.

910294.title: Small Screen, Big Impact: Celebrating Queer TV & Charting the Road Ahead
910294.description: Love queer TV? Don’t miss this special panel celebrating the past 20 years of LGBTQ television and looking ahead to what comes next! Megan Townsend (GLAAD’s Senior Director, Entertainment Research and Analysis) will be sharing brand new research and insights spotlighting LGBTQ TV characters and hosting a conversation with creators and executives about the future of queer storytelling in TV.

904409.title: The Lost Boys: Adapting the Film for Broadway with Producer Patrick Wilson
904409.description: We’re inviting you in. The Warner Bros. cult classic comes to Broadway next spring as one of the most anticipated musicals of the season. Join producer Patrick Wilson (The Conjuring, Watchmen), Tony Award–winning director Michael Arden (Maybe Happy Ending), and additional residents of Santa Carla as they discuss bringing Joel Schumacher’s beloved coming-of-age vampire film to the stage. Attendees will hear the first public performance from the cast. The Lost Boys: A New Musical features music and lyrics by The Rescues (Kyler England, Adrianne Gonzalez, and Gabriel Mann), and a book by David Hornsby (“It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia”) and Chris Hoch.

909821.title: Customizing Footwear and Beyond - Modifying Shoes, Jackets, and More!  [Separately Ticketed]
909821.description: Have the perfect cosplay shoes but they're the wrong color? Thrift an awesome pleather jacket that needs some pizzazz? In this class Cowbutt Crunchies covers the complete process needed to create a long lasting custom paint job on shoes, bags, and other leather or pleather items, using tape, stencils, sealers, and more! **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

909413.title: Disney Princess Meetup
909413.description: Join us for a relaxed gathering of Disney princess fans and cosplayers to snap amazing photos, share costume inspo, and enjoy some magical moments together. Whether you’re dressed up or just love the princess vibes, come hang out and strike your best pose!

896884.title: The Frights and Delights of Queer Horror Comics
896884.description: Description: From Bride of Frankenstein to The Babadook, horror has long been beloved by the Queer community. Join creators Tate Brombal, Nick Robles, Che Grayson and Tiny Onions own Courtney Menard & Jazzlyn Stone, as they chat about their favorite media and their own works of queer horror.

909588.title: Separately Ticketed Event - Spotlight on Jaysea Lynn
909588.description: From the fiery depths of the Hellp Desk to the unforgettable storytelling of For Whom the Belle Tolls, Jaysea Lynn brings her signature blend of demon smut, sharp wit, and soul-searching narratives to NYCC as she discusses the release of her debut novel, For Whom the Belle Tolls. This event requires a separate ticket and will include a signed copy of For Whom the Belle Tolls.

904766.title: Children's Book Council Presents: Draw With the Artists (Session A)
904766.description: Come and join the fun with each of our amazing graphic novel creators as they show you how they created their characters!

908316.title: Enter the Popverse
908316.description:
Join Popverse and a slew of surprise guests for a private discussion of what they’re working on. Get FREE NYCC swag and other merchandise, sneak peeks of upcoming projects, Q&A session, and more! Open only to Popverse Superfan and Fan members. Moderated by Chris Arrant & Ashley V. Robinson
Guests: Top Secret!

909736.title: X-Men: Days of Future Cast
909736.description: Mutants assemble! Join James McAvoy (Professor Charles Xavier), Nicholas Hoult (Hank McCoy/Beast), and Elliot Page (Kitty Pryde) for a special reunion celebrating their unforgettable roles in the X-Men film franchise. From the halls of Xavier’s School to the time-bending events of Days of Future Past, these fan-favorite stars reflect on what it meant to bring Marvel’s mutants to life on the big screen. Expect behind-the-scenes stories, character insights, and plenty of love for the films that reshaped superhero cinema for a new generation. No Cerebro required—just bring your inner mutant.
909736.people_list: Elliot Page, James McAvoy, Nicholas Hoult

896299.title: Fullmetal Foamsmith
896299.description: Wanted to make props but not sure how? Love crafting but want to expand your knowledge? Welcome to Fullmetal Foamsmith, where we teach you how to make props out of eva foam and worbla. This panel focuses on the foamsmithing aspect of cosplay, brought to you by cosplayers of color.
896299.people_list: Daria LeGall, Alyssa Franco, Cintia Castro

909591.title: Spotlight on R. L. Stine
909591.description: Readers Beware, you’re in for a scare! Master of childhood horror, R. L. Stine discusses the iconic Goosebumps series. Hear the story behind the story of the chapter books that became a global phenomenon. Moderated by New York Times bestselling author Erin Entrada.

909592.title: Everything You Need to Know about Indie Publishing
909592.description: Are you ready to publish your book, but you're not sure where to turn? One option, chosen by an ever-increasing number of writers, is to self-publish. Join this panel of experts as they discuss the process of, and challenges and opportunities presented by, independent publishing.

911159.title: Jedi Meditation
911159.description: Calling all Younglings! Learn tips and techniques used by the Jedi Masters themselves, or take a few moments of calm in your busy day at NYCC. Hosted by Saber Guild’s Empire Temple.

909412.title: Water, Earth, Fire, and Air, an Avatar The Last Airbender and Korra Meetup
909412.description:
Do you wanna have a fun chat with Uncle Iroh? How about face off with the Firelord in your best hero pose? Or you can just see and be seen in your favorite Avatar character cosplay! Come join us for THE GREAT NYCC HARMONIC CONVERGENCE AVATAR/KORRA MEETUP! Take pictures and enjoy the company of other cosplayers expressing their excitement, love and devotion of this 21st century animated masterpiece - Avatar The Last Airbender and The Legend of Kora. Don’t be shy, come by and let’s flip this cabbage cart !! YIP! YIP!!

Schedule image by: @jscosplayphotog

904131.title: Beyond Baki: Cosplay, Editing & New Challenges
904131.description: Step into the underground arena with Baki & Beyond! This special NYCC panel brings together the world of Baki the Grappler like never before. Join Logan Chitwood, the world-renowned Yujiro Hanma cosplayer, as he reveals his journey of becoming the “Strongest Creature on Earth.” Michael, the editor of Baki, will share behind-the-scenes stories from working on one of manga’s most legendary series. And get an exclusive look at what’s next from Kodama Tales, with the announcement of exciting new manga licenses debuting soon.

903877.title: Fandom Effect: How Fans Shape Pop Culture
903877.description: Pop culture has always brought people together. But the internet and social media have fractured the mono cultures that dominated an earlier era, producing a multiplicity of fan cultures. Today, fandoms creating community and connection all over the world has emerged, and fandom is a driving force in pop culture. Cosplay, fan zines, fan fiction, and other kinds of creative fan expression have made fandom more visible than ever. Join fans and fandom experts as they deep-dive into the world of fandom, how communities take shape, and how fans are taking their passions to the next level.

908263.title: Toei Animation Presents: DIGIMON BEATBREAK Panel
908263.description: Join Toei Animation for a special panel of DIGIMON BEATBREAK, the next evolution in the iconic Digimon franchise. Get a first look at what’s to come with exclusive insights and a special guest. Big surprises await fans at this NYCC exclusive panel!

909809.title: Making a Cosplay Prop with Masked Dad Workshop [Reservation Required]
909809.description: Learn to build a cosplay prop with Masked Dad Workshop, a cosplay supply company founded by two dads of color in NYC. This hands-on workshop will teach you essential tips and tricks to get started, and give you the chance to ask questions in person with experienced, award-winning cosplayers. **A reservation Is required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

909593.title: Children's Book Council Presents: Draw With the Artists (Session B)
909593.description: Come and join the fun with each of our amazing graphic novel creators as they show you how they created their characters!

909671.title: “Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake” Season 2 Sneak Peek
909671.description: Take your nearest subway, taxi, or multiversal portal to the Javits Center cause Adventure Time is returning to New York Comic Con! Join executive producer and showrunner Adam Muto along with voice cast members Madeleine Martin, Roz Ryan, and Ashly Burch for an exclusive sneak peek at the multiversal adventures that await in season 2 of the HBO Max Original series from Cartoon Network Studios, “Adventure Time: Fionna and Cake.”

893619.title: Manga Mavericks Books Industry Panel
893619.description: Join the team behind Manga Mavericks Books (store.mangamavericks.com) and find out how a company that started as a manga podcast has transformed itself into one of the newest indie manga publishers! Learn more about our upcoming slate of releases, as well as the library of content from our partner Red String Translations. We’ll have new announcements, prizes, and more!
893619.people_list: Varun Gupta, Michael JOKOH, Siddharth Gupta

909834.title: Drag Queen Story Hour
909834.description: Get ready for a fabulously fun time at NY Comic Con's Pride Lounge! Join the sensational Yuhua Hamasaki for Drag Queen Story Hour, where geek culture meets glitter and glam. Expect kids’ tales with a twist, as Yuhua dazzles you with her charisma and love for the comforting and accepting messages these stories provide. It’s a heartwarming celebration of inclusivity, perfect for fans of all ages!

909480.title: NYCC Staff Q+A
909480.description: Come say hi to the team, ask any question you want about the show or join our never-ending argument about X-Men vs Avengers.

911160.title: Star Wars Meetup
911160.description:
Whether you’re on the light side or the dark side, all Star Wars cosplayers and fans are welcome to this meetup hosted by Rebel Legion’s Echo Base.

Star Wars Meetup (Sunday):  
https://www.facebook.com/share/19ouqHng4w/?mibextid=wwXIfr
911160.people_list: Lisa Giunta-Popeil,  Rebel Legion - Echo Base

909027.title: Deconstructing Daredevil: Rage, Violence, and the 1980s
909027.description: There is no better place to talk Daredevil than at New York Comic Con! Take a closer look at Daredevil as we dive into his comic book publication history in the late 1980s, a critical period where Daredevil blossomed into the character we know and love today! Join former Marvel Comics editor and the first woman to ever write Daredevil, Ann Nocenti, along with another mystery guest (oooooh) as we dig into the neighborhood character of Hell’s Kitchen in the late ’80s, as well as Daredevil’s particular brand of morality, activism, violence, and of course, Catholic guilt. Fans Without Fear won’t want to miss this.

902862.title: Blerd Who Step: Drums of Liberation Edition
902862.description:
Are you a nerd who steps or who has always wanted to try stepping? This workshop will include a brief history of step in the black community, its evolution to becoming more mainstream, and what that means for those of us blerds who step.  

As a blerd who steps, I have taken the love for my various fandoms, and incorporated different aspects into my stepping. I run an entire step team composed of geeks of different fandoms, otaku, cosplayers, and gamers.  

The workshop is open to all levels of steppers and people of all cultural backgrounds. We will learn about step and learn 1 step to music from/inspired by One Piece. Please dress comfortably with supportive footwear (if you will be engaging in the standing portions). Stepping requires movements such as stomping, clapping, and lifting our arms and legs. If you have a disability that restricts your movement we will modify those movements for you. Cosplay is encouraged/welcomed, but not mandatory. So come join Luffy and move to the beat of liberation!

911375.title: R. L. Stine Book Signing
911375.description: Join R.L. Stine, the beloved and bestselling author of Goosebumps, as meets fans and signs books. In order to allow for a maximum number of fans, up to two books signed (books only, no memorabilia or other merchandise), no personalization, no posed photos. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the signing tables.

911383.title: Panel Coming Soon
911383.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

909428.title: DC Universe Meetup and Photoshoot
909428.description: DC Cosplayers East would like to welcome you to participate for our DC Universe Meetup and Photoshoot. If you are a DC Universe character (Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, etc…) this meetup is for you. Please join us Sunday, October 12th at 1:45PM at the north tower. This is our annual  meetup for all our Gotham, JLA, Titans as well as other DC Universe cosplayers and is a great way to network with other DC characters as well. We look forward to all the heroes and villains joining us at New York Comic Con. Check our event page on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/events/1456279961810927
909428.people_list: Robert Burdi, Sophia Elwell, Michael Gilbert, Angelo Maione, Carlos Smith, Izabelle Garcia, Taylor Van Ackem

909738.title: The Cast of The Matrix
909738.description:
Step back into the groundbreaking world of The Matrix with Joe Pantoliano (Cypher) and Laurence Fishburne (Morpheus), moderated by Josh Horowitz! Join these iconic stars as they reminisce about the making of the sci-fi phenomenon that redefined cinema. From mind-bending stunts and revolutionary visual effects to the unforgettable philosophy and world-building that continue to inspire fans and filmmakers alike, this panel is a deep dive into the reality-bending universe of the Matrix.
Under Josh Horowitz’s guidance, the cast will share behind-the-scenes stories, reflect on the experience of filming some of the most iconic action sequences in movie history, and discuss their characters’ journeys through a world where nothing is as it seems. Whether you’re a longtime fan or a newcomer to the Matrix, this conversation promises insight, nostalgia, and a few surprises from the legends who brought this universe to life."
909738.people_list: Laurence Fishburne, Joe Pantoliano, Josh Horowitz

909835.title: KIDS COSPLAY CONTEST
909835.description:
It’s Kids Day at Comic Con, and the runway is calling! RuPaul’s Drag Race stars Yuhua Hamasaki and Megami join forces to bring extra sparkle, laughs, and glam to the cutest cosplay competition of the weekend.

Cheer on our young superheroes, wizards, and warriors as they strut, twirl, and show off their creative costumes. With Yuhua and Megami at the helm, expect big smiles, fabulous energy, and a celebration of fandom for fans of all ages!

909594.title: Enchanting Entanglements
909594.description: Have you ever been reading a scene between a hero and their antagonist and thought “yes, good…now kiss!”? Have you ever wondered what it would be like to date your magic-wielding rival?  Then you know you are a Romantasy Lover… From epic fantasy and romance, to dark and twisted love stories and beyond, join Carissa Broadbent, Sara Raasch, Tricia Levenseller, Maddie Martinez, and Sarah Beth Durst for discussion of why romantasy is on the top of all of our TBRs.
909594.people_list: Tricia Levenseller, Sarah Raasch, Carissa Broadbent, Sarah Beth Durst, Maddie Martinez

909672.title: Panel Coming Soon
909672.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

904123.title: Image Comics Presents: Kyle Higgins: Radiant Black, The Massiverse & More!
904123.description: Join Massive-Verse superstars Kyle Higgins (RADIANT BLACK, NO/ONE), Brian Buccellato (NO/ONE), Melissa Flores (THE DEAD LUCKY), Ryan Parrott (ROGUE SUN), and more special surprise guests as the crew unveils exciting new developments and announcements in store for the Massive-verse this year and next!

903889.title: VIZ Showcase: First Looks and Renowned Talent
903889.description: Join VIZ for an unforgettable panel featuring legendary [redacted] for an exclusive Q&A and live drawing session! Watch the magic happen as they bring their latest hero from the world of (find out soon) to life. But that's not all, we also have a special Black Torch announcement. Incredible prizes, impressive art, and illustrious talent—only at the VIZ panel!

902870.title: Beyond the Mask: VTubers, Identity and Content Creation in the Digital Age
902870.description:
Creating content online today can be exciting, exhausting, and everything in between. Whether you're building a brand on Twitch, YouTube, TikTok, or behind a VTuber avatar, this panel dives into the reality of growing as a creator in a space that never slows down.

Join streamers, video creators, and corporations for a down to earth conversation about finding your voice, building a brand, growing a community, and making content that actually feels meaningful. We'll talk about starting from scratch, dealing with platform shifts, staying consistent, and keeping your sanity while doing it all in public.

This panel is for anyone who makes content, wants to make content, or is just curious about how creators make it all work behind the scenes.
902870.people_list: Michael Harvey, Sunshine Hall, Gabrielle Makatura

904421.title: Pokémon - I Choose You, HAUNTED Adventure!
904421.description:
You stayed up all night crafting the perfect fluffy tail for your Eevee Cosplay and barely made it to your Pokémon panel in time with all your Poké Balls and ears in tact. Do you valiantly rush up to the microphone and take your chance to be the very best? Or do use Teleport like an Abra?

TURN THE PAGE.

An original Pokémon story game starring: you!

911092.title: NYCC Networking
911092.description: Unwind and connect at NYCC Networking, the ultimate networking meetup designed for comic book creators, cosplayers, industry professionals, and fans eager to dive into the latest and greatest in the pop culture world! Enjoy a relaxed atmosphere perfect for forging new connections. Whether you’re looking to collaborate, find inspiration, or simply meet fellow enthusiasts, this is your chance to make meaningful connections in a low-key setting. Build relationships with key players in the community and discover new opportunities. Join us and take your networking experience to the next level! Let's celebrate creativity, exchange ideas, and forge new connections in a vibrant and friendly atmosphere.

909822.title: Totally Metal!  Create Your Own Chainmail [Separately Ticketed]
909822.description: Think the idea of knitting with metal rings sounds, well, metal?  Get your pliers ready as Cowbutt Crunchies walks through the basic materials and process for creating chainmail fabric: the building block for all chainmail garments.  Students will practice creating their own sample chainmail pieces, which they will be able to bring home and complete. **A separate ticket is required to attend this workshop. Workshop tickets will be going live in September, make sure to keep an eye out so you can grab your ticket before they are gone!

901427.title: Chainsaw Man SPECIAL PANEL
901427.description: Get an inside look at the making of Chainsaw Man – The Movie: Reze Arc with the creative team behind the film, brought to you by MAPPA!  The film hits U.S. theaters on October 29, 2025.  Hear behind-the-scenes stories, creative insights, and what to expect as the team gets ready to bring it to the big screen.

904034.title: Crossing Thresholds The Rise of Transgressive Horror
904034.description: Join authors Eric LaRocca, Hailey Piper and Clay McLeod Chapman as they take you on a journey into the heart of transgressive, LGBTQ+ horror fiction. Discover how their bold and fearless narratives challenge conventions and continue to reshape the horror fiction landscape, inviting readers to question, fear, and understand the complexities of the human experience. The panel will conclude with a Q&A session, allowing NYCC attendees to delve deeper into the authors’ processes, challenges, and future projects.
904034.people_list: Hailey Piper, Clay McLeod Chapman, Delilah S. Dawson, Eric LaRocca

911161.title: Blast-A-Trooper
911161.description: Interactive experience to “blast” Stormtroopers and Mandalorians with foam dart blasters; fundraiser for charity led by 501st ECG and Mandalorian Mercs Falco Clan.

909674.title: Panel Coming Soon
909674.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

904416.title: Horror Cosplay 101: An Intro to Cosplay
904416.description:
Ever wanted to explore horror cosplay but don’t know where to start? Join us as we go in depth of how you can not only put together a costume but also learn the basics of horror makeup (budget friendly), how to get into character with horror cosplay etiquette, and dark photography to capture your scary vision. 

Panelists are Missy Moody of Madame Moody Costume designs, award winning voice actor Stephan Watson, photographer Holly Simmonds of Ivynix photography, and long time haunt actor Abby Norm. 

This panel will be moderated by Josh Jurgens of Hunky Boyfriend Cosplay.
904416.people_list: Holly Simmonds, Stephan Watson, Marissa Moody

909029.title: Popversations
909029.description: Get past the glitz and get to know one of your favorite celebs, as Popverse’s Popversations makes its NYC debut. Come as Popverse’s Ashley V. Robinson and a guest to be announced cut past the pleasantries and talks about life, their passions, and what they are fans of.

909419.title: Horror and Spooky Season Cosplay Meetup
909419.description:
Boo! A spooktacular cosplay meetup for NYCC Sunday. All Ages welcome!
Show us the spookiest version of your favorite Comic, Anime and Pop culture characters.
From cutesy to mangled from children to veterans all are welcome to usher in the Halloween season NYCC style!

911374.title: Enchanting Entanglements - Post Panel Book Signing
911374.description: Join authors from the "Enchanting Entanglements" panel as they meet fans and sign books. Books will be available for purchase from the Barnes & Noble booth in Hall 1A, adjacent to the author signing area.
911374.people_list: Carissa Broadbent, Sarah Beth Durst, Tricia Levenseller, Maddie Martinez, Sarah Raasch

904752.title: Underlined YA Book Buzz
904752.description: Dive into the freshest YA reads with  Underlined! Get exclusive previews of upcoming releases and expert picks to fuel your next obsession. Perfect for readers hungry for the next big thing in YA fiction.

911384.title: Panel Coming Soon
911384.description:
The New York Comic Con team is cooking up something awesome! More details on this panel coming soon.

Stay up to date on the latest New York Comic Con news at NewYorkComicCon.com and on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

910122.title: It Rhymes With Takei
910122.description: Join legendary actor, activist, and author George Takei for a rare and personal conversation to close out his national book tour for It Rhymes With Takei. In this intimate room near Artist Alley, Takei reflects on his extraordinary life from internment to iconhood and the power of joy, resistance, and storytelling. Seating is limited for this special NYCC experience.

904291.title: Nailed It: Project Cosplay!
904291.description: Nailed It: Project Cosplay is back again for an incredible sixth year to bring you an hour of fun and creative competition! Think you have what it takes to cobble together a standout cosplay in an hour? Compete with your friends and family to create the cosplay of your dreams & win prizes! But don't worry our judges (fashion industry designers and cosplayers) will be there to coach you and cheer you on! So gather your crew and come to show off your skills. Trust us this will be the most fun you have at NYCC! Share the hype at IG @naileditprojectcosplay
904291.people_list: Dhareza Maramis, Rebecca Noel, Deanna Connelly, Meagan Connelly

909673.title: Phineas and Ferb Are Taking Over NYCC — and the Tri-State Area
909673.description: Great Googly Moogly! Join “Phineas and Ferb” co-creators Dan Povenmire and Swampy Marsh, and other musical masterminds behind the show’s most iconic hits. Enjoy brand-new songs, sing along to fan favorites, and get treated to sneak peeks, giveaways, and surprise guests.

909810.title: Making a Cosplay Prop with Masked Dad Workshop [Reservation Required]
909810.description: Learn to build a cosplay prop with Masked Dad Workshop, a cosplay supply company founded by two dads of color in NYC. This hands-on workshop will teach you essential tips and tricks to get started, and give you the chance to ask questions in person with experienced, award-winning cosplayers. **A reservation Is required to attend this workshop. Reservations will be going live in September- For more information about NYCC Reservations, visit: https://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/en-us/about/reservations.html

903844.title: Superman: Mensch of Steel!
903844.description: Between James Gunn's new Superman movie, DC's "Year of Superman," and the upcoming new season of "My Adventures with Superman," this is the perfect time to explore the Mensch of Steel's real-life origin story! Join a panel of creators and historians for a fascinating journey through comic book lore, American history and Jewish tradition that’ll give you a whole new appreciation for the world's greatest superhero.

903891.title: One-Punch Man Season 3 Ep1 Screening
903891.description: One-Punch Man Season 3 is back! Catch the first episode of One-Punch Man Season 3 on the big screen, fresh off its broadcast! Join fellow fans for an action-packed screening you won't want to miss!

909597.title: Cosplay Central Costume Showcase
909597.description:
The Cosplay Showcase is where fans and cosplayers can showcase their craftsmanship in style. This event is open to all cosplayers and is an opportunity for fans of all levels to strut their stuff in their costumes onstage. The Cosplay Showcase will take place on Sunday. There are prizes but cosplayers are free to take part just for fun if they do not wish to be judged. Family Groups and Juniors are welcome to take part.
Sign up to take part during the show at the Cosplay Admin desk in Cosplay Central. Places are limited so visit us as early as you can to secure a space. On the day registration will close at 12:00pm.

909717.title: Cookie Run: Learn to Play Experience at NYCC
909717.description:
Step into the whimsical world of Cookie Run at New York Comic Con! Whether you’re a seasoned gamer or brand new to the franchise, our Learn to Play activation is the perfect way to jump in. Guided by our friendly demo team, you’ll explore the vibrant Cookie Run Kingdom, master the core rules, and experience the excitement of gameplay firsthand.

Come for the fun, stay for the cookie. No prior experience required - let’s play!

901048.title: Makeup, madman, monsters and those that make them
901048.description: A panel of makeup artists that have careers that have collectively spanned over 100 years and have over 100s of credits describe and explain, via, visuals and practical examples of their work
901048.people_list: Craig Lindberg, Neal Jones, Melanie Licata, Richard Krusell

909030.title: Popversus: Comic Writers vs. Comic Artists
909030.description: Who is better: comic writers or comic artists? It’s a debate that rattles social media, and now Popverse is calling it to the carpet for the pop culture fight club we like to call Popversus. Join Popverse’s Ashley V. Robinson as she moderates/referees a playful debate between comics artist Mitch Gerads (Mister Miracle, Batman) and comics writer Tom King (Mister Miracle, Batman) where they choose a side and duke it out – with words, not fists. At the end a winner will be decided – not by us, but by you in the audience!

909424.title: Sanrio, Tamagotchi & More: Kawaii Friends Forever
909424.description: Calling all Hello Kitty lovers, Kuromi cuties, Cinnamoroll sweethearts, Tamagotchi owners and lovers of all things cute! Whether you're decked out in pastel cosplay, rocking your favorite Sanrio tee, or proudly carrying your digital pet keychain- this is your ultimate kawaii haven at New York Comic Con! Join fellow fans to gush over adorable characters, swap stickers, trade charms, and share heartwarming stories about your vintage or new digital pets. Snap pics with fellow cuties, show off your Tamagotchis and virtual companions, and celebrate the magic of friendship—Sanrio & pixel-style! Let’s make it a sweet, sparkly, and super-cute celebration you won’t forget! Perfectly matching this year's NYCC theme, this meetup is so cute its scary

911162.title: Jedi Meditation
911162.description: Calling all Younglings! Learn tips and techniques used by the Jedi Masters themselves, or take a few moments of calm in your busy day at NYCC. Hosted by Saber Guild’s Empire Temple.
